universityName: Western Sydney University - Sydney City Campus
tagline: Unlimited Opportunities, Global Impact
description: Established in 1989, Western Sydney University (WSU) is a public university with its Sydney City Campus, operated by Navitas, located in the heart of Sydney’s CBD. Offering over 15 undergraduate and postgraduate programs, the campus specializes in business, IT, and accounting, delivered through the Sydney Institute of Business and Technology (SIBT). With a focus on practical, career-oriented education and a 30% acceptance rate, WSU Sydney City attracts over 6,000 international students from 170+ countries, fostering a multicultural environment with access to modern facilities and strong industry connections.

generalInfo: International students at WSU Sydney City Campus apply through the university’s online portal or UAC, submitting academic transcripts, proof of English proficiency, and financial documentation. The International Office provides visa support, free airport pick-up, and access to career services, including internships and the JobTeaser platform. With a 5-star QS rating for teaching and facilities, the campus ensures a vibrant, supportive learning environment in Sydney’s dynamic CBD.

generalRequirements[3]: Official document of financial support (AUD 29,710/year minimum for visa)

tagline: Excellence in Education and Liberal Arts
description: BRAC University, established in 2001, is a leading private research university in Dhaka, Bangladesh, following a liberal arts approach to education that nurtures fresh ideas and critical thinking. It offers undergraduate and graduate programs in fields such as business, computer science, engineering, architecture, English, economics, and more, with a strong emphasis on research, innovation, and social impact. Serving a diverse student body, including over 150 international students, BRAC University fosters global perspectives and community engagement through its modern facilities and international collaborations.

universityName: William Blue College of Hospitality Management
tagline: Launching Global Hospitality Careers
description: William Blue College of Hospitality Management, founded in 1990, is a private hospitality college under Torrens University Australia, located in Sydney and Brisbane. Renowned for its practical, industry-focused programs in hospitality, tourism, event management, and culinary arts, it leverages strong connections with global industry leaders like Disney International and Merivale. Its teaching team brings over 300 years of combined experience, preparing students for global careers.

universityName: Australian National Institute of Management and Commerce
tagline: Excellence in Business Education
description: The Australian National Institute of Management and Commerce (NIMC), established in 2002, is a leading private higher education provider in Australia specializing in business, management, and commerce programs. Registered with CRICOS for international students, NIMC offers diplomas and advanced diplomas in partnership with leading Australian universities, delivering practical, industry-focused education. Located in the heart of Sydney, it attracts a diverse international student body, emphasizing career readiness, ethical leadership, and global business perspectives through modern facilities and expert faculty.

generalInfo: NIMC provides a supportive learning environment with small class sizes, personalized mentoring, and strong industry connections for internships and employment. International applicants must apply online, submitting academic qualifications equivalent to Australian Year 12, English proficiency (IELTS 5.5+), and undergo a skills assessment if required. The institute facilitates student success through career workshops, alumni networks, and pathways to university degrees.

tagline: Don’t Follow. Lead.
description: Born from an iconic design magazine, Billy Blue College of Design at Torrens University Australia is the nation’s boldest creative school. With studios that mirror real agencies, students tackle live briefs for brands like Vogue, Google and Canva. 96% of graduates land jobs within 6 months – many before they even walk the stage.

tagline: Stand for More – Beachside Brilliance

Every student completes at least 12 weeks of paid industry placement; 94% secure full-time jobs within 4 months.

tagline: Leading in Technical Education and Innovation
description: Azerbaijan Technical University (AzTU), established in 1950, is a prominent public engineering university in Baku, Azerbaijan. Featuring 9 faculties and 54 departments, it enrolls over 10,000 students, including 292 international ones, in bachelor's, master's, and PhD programs across engineering, technology, physics, chemistry, and business. AzTU prioritizes practical training, research innovation, and global partnerships, equipping graduates with skills for competitive careers in technical fields.

tagline: Education is Light
description: The University of Dhaka (DU), established in 1921, is the oldest and premier public research university in Bangladesh. Located on a 600-acre campus in the heart of Dhaka, DU comprises 13 faculties, 83 departments, 12 institutes, and over 56 research centers. It offers diverse undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs in humanities, social sciences, natural sciences, business, law, and fine arts. With a commitment to academic excellence, research innovation, and societal impact, DU serves around 37,000 students, including internationals, and boasts a legacy of producing national leaders and scholars in a vibrant, multicultural setting.

tagline: Excellence in Education, Research, and Innovation
description: Jahangirnagar University (JU), established in 1970, is a fully residential public research university located in Savar, near Dhaka, Bangladesh. It features 36 departments across five faculties and six institutes, offering programs in arts, sciences, social sciences, business, and biological sciences. Known for its lush, eco-friendly campus encircled by trees and lakes, JU promotes academic excellence, research, and cultural activities, serving a diverse student body and fostering global perspectives through international collaborations.

tagline: Start Well, Finish Brilliantly
description: Established in 2023 in partnership with the Education Centre of Australia (ECA), Victoria University – Brisbane is an international campus of Victoria University, a top 2% global university (Times Higher Education 2024). Located in vibrant Fortitude Valley, it offers industry-relevant courses in business, information technology, and early childhood education using the award-winning VU Block Model®, focusing on one subject at a time for enhanced learning. With a multicultural student body and strong industry connections, VU Brisbane prepares students for global careers in one of Australia’s most livable cities.

Every UNSW student completes at least 60 days of industry placement; 93% secure full-time jobs within 4 months of graduation.

tagline: Real-World Business Education
description: Kaplan Business School (KBS), founded in 2009, is a leading private higher education provider in Australia specializing in business, accounting, information technology, and management. As part of the Kaplan group, KBS offers diplomas, undergraduate, and postgraduate degrees across multiple campuses, emphasizing practical skills, industry partnerships, and global perspectives. With a strong focus on employability, KBS delivers flexible learning options including online and on-campus modes, attracting a diverse international student body and preparing graduates for dynamic careers in business sectors.

universityName: Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology
tagline: Excellence in Engineering Education and Research
description: Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET), established in 1962 as East Pakistan University of Engineering and Technology and renamed post-independence, is Bangladesh's premier public engineering university. Located on an 83.9-acre campus in central Dhaka, BUET offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs across 18 departments under five faculties: Architecture and Planning, Civil Engineering, Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, and Engineering. Renowned for producing top engineers and contributing to national infrastructure, BUET emphasizes research in sustainable development and technology. Ranked #761-770 in QS World University Rankings 2025, #801-850 in THE 2024, and #1 in Bangladesh for engineering, it fosters innovation through partnerships with Huawei, Walton, and global institutions.

generalInfo: BUET welcomes international students through a competitive admission process, requiring transcripts, English proficiency, and entrance exams. With limited seats (26 per year, max 10 per country), it focuses on practical training, research projects, and industry internships. Graduate employability exceeds 95%, supported by career services and alumni networks. The urban Dhaka campus features modern labs, libraries, sports facilities, and hostels, offering a dynamic, multicultural environment with strong emphasis on innovation and community service.

tagline: Center of Excellence in Higher Education
description: North South University (NSU), founded in 1992, is Bangladesh’s first private university and remains the nation’s #1 ranked private institution (QS Asia). Fully UGC & ACBSP accredited, NSU offers 48 undergraduate and 22 graduate programs—all taught in English—across Business, Engineering, Health Sciences, Humanities, and Social Sciences. With 70% faculty holding PhDs from USA/UK/Canada, state-of-the-art labs, and partnerships with MIT, Duke, and Monash, NSU produces CEOs of bKash, Pathao, and top bankers.

tagline: Created for Good – Shaping Leaders Who Change the World

tagline: Faith-Inspired Education for a Changing World
description: Excelsia College, established in 2017 through the merger of historic Christian institutions, is a leading private higher education provider in Sydney, Australia, specializing in business, education, counselling, and creative arts with a faith-based ethos. Registered with TEQSA and CRICOS, it offers undergraduate and postgraduate degrees, diplomas, and certificates in partnership with leading universities, emphasizing holistic development, ethical leadership, and practical skills. Located in vibrant Macquarie Park, Excelsia fosters a diverse international community, preparing graduates for impactful careers through innovative teaching and strong industry connections.

tagline: Seek wisdom with a leading university for employability
description: The University of Western Australia (UWA), established in 1911, is a prestigious public research university ranked 77th in the QS World University Rankings 2025. Located in Perth, it offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs across arts, business, engineering, health sciences, law, and science. With over 25,000 students including more than 4,000 international students, UWA emphasizes innovative research, industry partnerships, and global employability, fostering a vibrant campus life in a stunning natural setting.

tagline: Where Europe and Asia Meet
description: Baku State University (BSU), founded on September 1, 1919, by the Parliament of the Azerbaijan Democratic Republic, is the oldest and premier public university in Azerbaijan. Established as a bridge between Europe and Asia, it began with faculties in history and philology, physics and mathematics, law, and medicine, enrolling 1,094 students. Today, BSU offers comprehensive programs across 14 faculties and 116 specialties, emphasizing sciences, humanities, and international relations. With 37 research labs and strong global ties, including membership in the European University Association (EUA), BSU leads in research and education. Ranked 688 in QS World University Rankings 2025 (top in Azerbaijan), 951 overall in QS, 401-600 in THE Impact Rankings 2025, and 825 in RUR Rankings 2025, it fosters innovation and cultural exchange for over 25,000 students.

tagline: Unlock Your Creative Potential in Music, Film, and Design

tagline: Free Thinking. Real World Ready.
description: Murdoch University is Perth’s only campus built inside a 270-hectare native bushland reserve. Ranked in the world’s top 100 young universities (THE Young 2024), Murdoch delivers 250+ courses across Business, Law, Health, Engineering, IT, Creative Arts, Science and Education. Every student completes at least one real-world placement; 95% of graduates secure full-time jobs within 4 months.

tagline: A Smart, Caring, Inclusive Community

tagline: All About You
description: The University of Canberra (UC), established in 1967, is a dynamic public research university located in Australia's capital, offering immersive, profession-focused education across five faculties. Renowned for employability (#1 in Canberra, GUG 2025) and impact (top 7 globally for reducing inequalities, THE 2024), UC serves over 18,000 students, including thousands of internationals from 100 countries. With strong industry ties, innovative research, and pathways to real-world experience, UC prepares graduates for leadership in business, health, education, law, arts, design, science, and technology.

tagline: Tradition and Innovation
description: Peking University (PKU), established in 1898 as China's first modern national university, is a premier public research institution in Beijing. As a founding member of the C9 League, it spans 31 schools and departments offering comprehensive programs in humanities, social sciences, natural sciences, engineering, medicine, and management. With over 35,000 students including 5,000+ internationals from 100+ countries, PKU emphasizes academic excellence, innovation, and global engagement through extensive research and international partnerships.

Boasting a 90%+ graduate employment rate in key fields with 87% job satisfaction, PKU mandates internships and offers over 100 scholarships annually. The historic Yanyuan campus, spanning 274 hectares, features iconic Weiming Lake and fosters a vibrant multicultural environment with clubs, cultural events, and research opportunities.

tagline: Rich in Knowledge and Tenacious of Purposes, Inquiring with Earnestness and Reflecting with Self-practice
description: Fudan University, founded in 1905 as Fudan Public School, is one of China's oldest and most prestigious universities, a member of the elite C9 League. Located in Shanghai, it spans four campuses and offers 70 undergraduate, 224 master's, and 154 doctoral programs across disciplines like humanities, sciences, medicine, engineering, and business. With a strong emphasis on research, innovation, and global collaboration, Fudan hosts over 4,000 international students from 130+ countries, fostering academic excellence and cultural exchange.

Home to more than 7,000 international students, it fosters innovation through extensive research facilities and global partnerships.

tagline: Germany's Oldest University – Excellence in Research and Teaching Since 1386

Renowned for its interdisciplinary approach, historic campus, and global partnerships, it ranks #84 in QS World University Rankings 2025 and excels in research impact.

campusName: Paris Saint-Germain Campus | Nice Riviera Campus
tagline: Responsible Managers for a Changing World
description: IPAG Business School, founded in 1965, is an independent non-profit French Grande École delivering state-recognised Bachelor, Master & MBA degrees. With iconic campuses in Paris (Saint-Germain) and Nice (Riviera), IPAG trains ethical, agile leaders through 100 % English BBA, MBA & MSc tracks, 12–18 months paid internships, and mandatory semesters abroad. Ranked in Shanghai & RePEc, IPAG’s research lab drives innovation in energy transition, digital ethics, and sustainable finance. 96 % of graduates employed within 4 months.

tagline: Mente et manu (With wisdom and hands)
description: Tallinn University of Technology (TalTech), founded in 1918, is Estonia's only technical university and a leading public research institution in Tallinn. Comprising five schools, it offers over 100 programs in engineering, IT, business, natural sciences, and maritime studies to approximately 9,100 students, including 16% international. TalTech excels in innovation, digital transformation, and practical education through internships, research projects, and global partnerships, fostering high employability in Estonia's thriving tech ecosystem.

EU/EEA students study tuition-free; non-EU pay fees but access scholarships. The green, smart campus features modern labs, libraries, and sports facilities in a vibrant, affordable city.

tagline: A Bold Business School
description: Audencia Business School, founded in 1900, is a leading private business school in Nantes, France, holding the prestigious triple accreditation (EQUIS, AACSB, AMBA), placing it among the top 1% worldwide. With over 6,000 students, including 3,200 international from 120 nationalities, it offers English-taught Bachelor, Master, and MBA programs in management, finance, marketing, and sustainable business. Ranked 7th in France for Masters in Management (FT 2023), Audencia emphasizes responsible management, innovation, and global employability through 900+ corporate partners, achieving 92% graduate employment within 2 months.

It provides comprehensive support including visa assistance, housing platforms, and cultural integration via the Buddy Door International team. Graduates earn EU-recognized degrees, benefiting from strong alumni networks and partnerships for internships and jobs, with a focus on sustainable and positive impact careers.

tagline: The American Way of Learning
description: CEFAM (Centre d'Etudes Franco-Américain de Management), founded in 1986, is a pioneering Franco-American business school in Lyon, France, specializing in management and international relations. Offering a unique American-style education with all classes 100% in English and in-person, CEFAM enables students to earn dual French and North American degrees through partnerships with 11 top U.S. and Canadian universities. AACSB-accredited, it prepares global leaders with practical skills, boasting a 92% employment rate within six months of graduation and a vibrant international community.

tagline: Get your passport for a successful international career
description: Founded in 1895, Le Cordon Bleu Paris is the original and flagship institute of the world's leading network of culinary arts and hospitality management schools, with over 35 institutes globally. Specializing in haute cuisine, pastry, boulangerie, wine, and management, it offers intensive diplomas, certificates, and advanced programs in English and French. Attracting students from over 130 nationalities, Le Cordon Bleu Paris combines traditional French techniques with modern innovation, boasting renowned alumni like Julia Child and providing pathways to international careers in gastronomy and hospitality.

tagline: First National University in the Caucasus
description: Ivane Javakhishvili Tbilisi State University (TSU), founded in 1918, is the oldest and largest public research university in Georgia and the Caucasus region. With 7 faculties and over 200 accredited programs taught in Georgian and English, TSU drives innovation in sciences, humanities, medicine, and social sciences. Its 5% international student body enjoys partnerships with 200+ global universities, cutting-edge research labs, and a vibrant historic campus in the heart of Tbilisi.

tagline: Your interesting life starts here
description: Ilia State University (ISU), founded in 2006 through the merger of six academic institutions, is a leading public research university in Tbilisi, Georgia, and the flagship higher education institution in the South Caucasus. With a focus on scientific advancement, knowledge transfer, and societal development, ISU emphasizes academic freedom, conscience, and choice. It hosts over 16,000 students and 1,500 staff across four faculties, offering programs in social sciences, humanities, business, law, natural sciences, medicine, and more, alongside 30 research institutes fostering innovation and international collaboration.

Admission requires academic transcripts, proof of English proficiency (waivable for English-medium graduates), financial documentation, and a passport. tagline: Where the World Comes to Think
description: Ludwig Maximilian University of Munich (LMU), founded in 1472 by Duke Ludwig IX, is one of Europe's oldest and most prestigious public research universities. Ranked 59th in the QS World University Rankings 2025, LMU excels in humanities, natural sciences, medicine, law, and economics, with 18 Nobel laureates among its alumni and faculty. Hosting over 52,000 students, including 15% international, LMU offers a comprehensive range of programs in German and English, emphasizing interdisciplinary research, innovation, and global collaboration in Munich's vibrant cultural hub.

description: IDRAC Business School, founded in 1965, is a leading private French “Grande École” network with 9 vibrant campuses and a pedagogy built on encouragement, real-world projects, and personalized coaching. Member of the Conférence des Grandes Écoles and EFMD, IDRAC delivers state-viséd Bachelor and Master degrees fully recognized across the EU. 100 % English tracks (Bachelor Year 3 & full PGE semesters) welcome non-French speakers. Mandatory 12–32 months abroad + 18 months paid internships with L’Oréal, LVMH, Airbus, and Decathlon guarantee 360° global exposure and 94 % employment within 3 months.

tagline: International Business Education with Global Perspective
description: Founded in 1967 as a non-profit institution by French corporate executives, Institut Supérieur de Gestion (ISG Business School) is a leading private business school in Paris offering English-taught BBA, MSc, and MBA programs in international business, marketing, finance, and luxury management. Part of the IONIS Education Group, ISG emphasizes practical skills, international partnerships, and employability, attracting over 1,000 students from more than 60 countries with campuses in Paris, Lille, and international sites in Shanghai and New York.

tagline: Leading Institution in Engineering and Technology in the South Caucasus
description: Georgian Technical University (GTU), founded in 1922 as a polytechnic faculty of Tbilisi State University and granted full university status in 1990, is the largest and leading technical university in Georgia. Located in Tbilisi, GTU specializes in engineering, technology, and applied sciences, with 12 faculties and 15 research institutes. It has produced over 60% of Georgia's engineering and scientific professionals, partnering with global institutions like CERN, MIT, and KEK. Ranked 901-950 in QS World University Rankings 2025 and 1501+ in THE World University Rankings 2025, GTU emphasizes innovation, research, and practical education for regional development.

generalInfo: Georgian Technical University welcomes international students with programs in English, Georgian, and Russian, requiring academic transcripts, proof of English proficiency, and financial documentation. With a 70-80% acceptance rate, GTU focuses on practical training through labs, internships, and global exchanges with over 75 international partners. It boasts a 90% graduate employment rate, supported by career services, job fairs, and modern facilities including a mini hydroelectric power station lab and one of Georgia's largest libraries with over 1.7 million books. The urban Tbilisi campus fosters innovation in a vibrant, multicultural environment.

tagline: Make your talent a success
description: Keyce Academy, founded in 1995, is a private higher education institution in France, part of the Collège de Paris network, bringing together five specialized schools: Keyce Business School, Keyce Tourisme, Keyce Santé, Keyce Impact, and Keyce Informatique. Offering programs from Bac to Bac+5 in initial or apprenticeship modes, it focuses on business, tourism, health, IT, and positive impact fields. With 17 campuses in France (Montpellier, Toulouse, Lyon, etc.) and overseas (Martinique, Guadeloupe, etc.), Keyce serves 1,200 students, emphasizing practical training, international mobility, and state-recognized RNCP qualifications for global careers.

tagline: Excellence in Education and Research for Sustainable Development
description: Ain Shams University (ASU), founded in 1950, is one of Egypt's oldest and largest public universities, located in Cairo. It offers a wide range of undergraduate, graduate, and postgraduate programs across 20 faculties, including medicine, engineering, sciences, law, arts, and business. With seven campuses and a commitment to research and innovation, ASU serves a diverse student body, fostering academic excellence and societal impact through international collaborations and community engagement.

tagline: Réinventez le Voyage
description: IEFT - Tourism and Hospitality Management, founded in 1981, is a private specialized school in France offering career-oriented programs in tourism management. Part of the FIGS Education group and partnered with IFAG, it prepares students for dynamic roles in travel, accommodation, transportation, leisure, destination marketing, business tourism, and events through immersive pedagogy, real-world projects, and 700+ corporate partners. With campuses in Bordeaux, Le Mans, Lyon, Montpellier, Nantes, and Paris, IEFT delivers RNCP-recognized diplomas from BTS to MBA levels, emphasizing sustainable and international tourism practices for a multicultural student body.

tagline: Passing on the Knowledge
description: Aristotle University of Thessaloniki (AUTH), established in 1926, is the largest university in Greece and one of the oldest in southeastern Europe. Located in vibrant Thessaloniki, it comprises 10 faculties and 40 schools offering diverse programs in sciences, engineering, medicine, humanities, and social sciences. With over 88,000 students, including more than 2,500 internationals, AUTH emphasizes research excellence, innovation, and international mobility through programs like Erasmus+.

tagline: Mother University of Egypt
description: Cairo University, founded in 1908 as the Egyptian University, is Egypt’s flagship public research university and the largest in the Arab world. Overlooking the Nile in Giza, it hosts 26 faculties and 10 institutes, delivering Arabic-medium and select English-taught programs in medicine, engineering, law, sciences, and humanities. With 7% international students from 100+ countries and partnerships with UNESCO, WHO, and Harvard, CU drives cutting-edge research and produces presidents, Nobel laureates, and global CEOs.

tagline: L’école du commerce international durable et solidaire
description: École 3A (ESCD 3A), founded in 1984, is France’s pioneering school of responsible and sustainable international business. Located in the heart of Paris La Défense, the Paris campus immerses students in Europe’s largest business district. Programs blend management, geopolitics, anthropology, and sustainable development to train “enlightened citizens of the world”. All courses are 100 % in French, with mandatory 3–6 month international internships and partnerships in Scotland, China, Mexico, and Germany. Graduates work in NGOs, ethical multinationals, impact start-ups, and international organisations.

generalInfo: École 3A selects motivated students via dossier + written tests + individual interview. No English-taught programs; B2 French (DELF/TCF) required for non-native speakers. The International Office assists with VLS-TS visa, CROUS housing applications, and CAF rent subsidies. 70 % of students complete at least one semester abroad. Alumni network “3Ayens du Monde” active in 60 countries.

tagline: Shaping the Future of Creative Industries
stats[1]: Recognized by French Ministry of Culture
description: Founded in 1986, LISAA School of Art & Design is France's largest applied arts institution, offering innovative Bachelor's and Master's programs in graphic design, fashion, interior architecture, animation, video games, and more. With campuses in Paris and six other French cities, it serves over 5,000 students from more than 50 nationalities, emphasizing practical training, industry partnerships, and international mobility through Erasmus+ and Cumulus networks. Ranked among top private art schools by L'Étudiant and Le Figaro, 93% of graduates secure creative careers within six months.

Graduates earn RNCP Level 6/7 qualifications (EU-recognized), benefiting from a global alumni network and 93% employment rate in creative fields within six months.

stats[1]: Hellenic Authority for Higher Education (HAHE) Accredited
description: The University of Patras (UPatras), founded in 1964, is Greece's third-largest public university, renowned for its contributions to research in health, environment, biotechnology, and engineering. Spanning seven schools and 31 departments, it offers a wide array of undergraduate and postgraduate programs. With over 1,700 international students from diverse backgrounds, UPatras fosters innovation through global partnerships and initiatives like the UPSat satellite project, promoting sustainable development and academic excellence.

tagline: Excellence in Education and Research
description: The University of Tartu (UT), founded in 1632 by King Gustavus Adolphus of Sweden, is Estonia's oldest and most prestigious public research university, serving as the national university. Located in Tartu, Estonia's intellectual capital, UT offers over 100 programs across four faculties: Arts and Humanities, Social Sciences, Medicine, and Science and Technology. Renowned for research in clinical medicine, chemistry, environmental sciences, and social sciences, UT ranks in the top 1% of the world's most cited universities. It is ranked #=362 in QS World University Rankings 2026, 301-350 in THE World University Rankings 2025, and #236 in US News Best Global Universities 2025, with strong global partnerships and a focus on innovation and sustainability.

generalInfo: The University of Tartu welcomes international students through its online application portal, requiring academic transcripts, English proficiency, and financial proof. With 31 English-taught programs, UT emphasizes research-based education, internships, and exchanges with 79 partners in 31 countries. It boasts a 95% graduate employment rate, supported by career services and a vibrant student life. The historic yet modern Tartu campus, with over 100 buildings including museums and a botanical garden, offers affordable living, cultural immersion, and easy access to facilities near the city center.

universityName: Institut de Gestion et d'Etudes Financières (IGEFI)
tagline: France's Oldest Accounting School
description: IGEFI, founded in 1873, is France's oldest and most renowned accounting school, specializing in corporate finance, accounting expertise, and management. As part of FIGS Education Group, it offers high-level, state-recognized programs from Bac+2 to Bac+5 across five campuses in major French cities. With a strong emphasis on practical training and industry partnerships, IGEFI prepares students for careers in finance and administration, boasting a 100% diploma recognition rate and a global alumni network in over 50 countries.

tagline: Come to study for a British or Irish degree at a truly international business school in the heart of Europe!
description: Founded in 1991 as the first private higher education institution in Central Europe, International Business School (IBS) in Budapest offers accredited Bachelor's, Master's, and PhD programs leading to British and Irish degrees. With a focus on international business and management, IBS attracts over 300 students from more than 100 countries annually, providing a multicultural learning environment supported by partnerships with The University of Buckingham and Dublin Business School.

International students must demonstrate B2 English for undergraduate and C1 for graduate programs. The school facilitates visa processes and offers pathways for language improvement through its International University Foundation program. Alumni pursue careers in global business, benefiting from EU-recognized qualifications and a strong international network.

tagline: Veritas, Probitas, Iustitia – Truth, Honesty, Justice
description: Universitas Indonesia (UI), founded in 1849 as a medical school, is Indonesia’s oldest and top-ranked public research university. With 16 faculties and 400+ programs, UI is the only Indonesian university in the global top 250. Its green 320-hectare Depok campus and historic Salemba medical complex host Indonesia’s largest academic community, producing presidents, ministers, and CEOs of Gojek & Tokopedia.

tagline: An American Liberal Arts Education in the Heart of Europe
description: American College Dublin (ACD), a constituent college of Irish American University, is a private not-for-profit liberal arts institution founded in 1993. Located in four restored Georgian townhouses on historic Merrion Square – including Oscar Wilde’s childhood home – ACD offers US-accredited bachelor’s and master’s degrees that are also validated by QQI on the Irish NFQ. With an average class size of 20, mandatory internships, and a 1:12 faculty ratio, ACD delivers personalised American-style education in creative writing, performing arts, international business, hospitality, and liberal arts.

Graduates earn dual US & EU awards, enabling work in Europe or North America. Campus includes Wilde’s library, rehearsal studios, Mac labs, and a student lounge in a UNESCO-protected square.

tagline: Our Dedication. Your Journey.
description: CCT College Dublin, established in 2005 as the College of Computing Technology, is a leading private higher education institution in Ireland specializing in QQI-validated programs in Computing, Information Technology, and Business. Located in Dublin city centre, it offers full-time, part-time, and blended learning options at undergraduate and postgraduate levels, emphasizing practical skills, industry relevance, and employability. With a commitment to innovation, accessibility, and diversity, CCT fosters a vibrant international community, preparing graduates for dynamic careers in tech, business, and related fields through expert-led teaching and comprehensive support services.

tagline: Learn today. Lead tomorrow.
description: Founded in 1975, Dublin Business School (DBS) is Ireland's largest independent third-level college, specializing in career-focused programs in business, law, psychology, computing, and media. Validated by Quality and Qualifications Ireland (QQI) and awarding degrees from Liverpool John Moores University and Quality and Qualifications Ireland, DBS offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and professional qualifications to a diverse international student body. With a commitment to employability, practical learning, and industry partnerships, DBS equips students for global careers in a vibrant, central Dublin location.

tagline: To learn and to apply, for the benefit of mankind
description: The Hong Kong Polytechnic University (PolyU), established in 1937, is a public research university located in Hung Hom, Kowloon. Renowned for its innovative and professionally oriented education, PolyU offers over 160 undergraduate and postgraduate programs across eight faculties and schools, focusing on applied sciences, engineering, business, design, health, and hospitality. With strong industry ties and a commitment to experiential learning, including internships and global exchanges, PolyU prepares students for impactful careers, boasting high employability rates and contributions to real-world innovations.

tagline: Inspired by Creativity
description: Budapest Metropolitan University (METU), established in 2000, is a private higher education institution in Budapest, Hungary, offering state-accredited BA/BSc and MA/MSc programs in English. Specializing in communication and media studies, business and management, tourism and hospitality, and applied arts, METU serves nearly 7,000 students, including over 1,000 international students from more than 100 countries. Following the Bologna Process, it provides EU-recognized degrees with a focus on practical, creative education through modern facilities, international partnerships, and industry collaborations.

tagline: Tradition Meets Innovation
description: The University of Sopron, with roots tracing back to 1735, is one of Hungary's oldest public universities, renowned for its focus on sustainable development, forestry, wood sciences, economics, and environmental engineering. Located in the picturesque city of Sopron near the Austrian border, it offers a range of English-taught programs from bachelor to doctoral levels, attracting international students with its blend of historical tradition and modern innovation. Accredited by the Hungarian Ministry of Education, the university emphasizes practical training, research, and international collaborations to prepare students for global careers.

tagline: Practice-Focused Business Education in the Heart of Europe
description: Founded in 2006, Wekerle Sándor Business School is a private institution in Budapest offering practice-oriented programs in business administration, commerce, marketing, and business informatics. With a focus on real-life scenarios and job market needs, it provides foundation, bachelor's, and master's degrees in English, German, and Hungarian, attracting international students through partnerships and a supportive learning environment.

International students need B2 English proficiency, with foundation programs available for preparation. The school assists with visa processes and offers a vibrant student life with cultural programs, clubs, and modern facilities in central Budapest.

tagline: We Turn Ideas into Engineering
stats[1]: Accredited by Hungarian Ministry of Education
description: Óbuda University, established in 2000 through the merger of historic technical institutions dating back to 1879, is a leading public technical university in Hungary specializing in engineering, informatics, and applied sciences. With over 12,000 students across five campuses, it emphasizes practical, innovation-driven education and holds accreditation from the Hungarian Ministry of Education. Offering English-taught programs from bachelor to doctoral levels, Óbuda fosters global partnerships and research excellence, preparing students for careers in technology and industry.

tagline: Inspiring Change Leaders
description: Established in 2007, Independent College Dublin is a private specialist third-level institution focusing on Business and Law programs. Accredited by Quality and Qualifications Ireland (QQI), it offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and professional courses designed for employability in Ireland's financial and tech sectors. Located at the edge of Silicon Docks in central Dublin, the college emphasizes transformative education, critical thinking, and industry connections, serving a diverse international student body with practical, career-oriented learning experiences.

campusName: Ho Sin Hang Campus, Shaw Campus, Baptist University Road Campus
tagline: Nurturing Whole Person Education for Global Citizens
description: Hong Kong Baptist University (HKBU), established in 1956 as a Baptist college and granted full university status in 1994, is a leading public liberal arts university in Asia. Located in the vibrant district of Kowloon Tong, HKBU is committed to whole person education, fostering intellectual, moral, physical, and social development. With over 50 undergraduate and postgraduate programs across seven faculties including Arts, Business, Communication, Science, Social Sciences, Visual Arts, and the School of Chinese Medicine, it emphasizes research excellence, bilinguality, and global engagement. HKBU's diverse community of over 10,000 students benefits from strong industry partnerships and a dynamic campus life.

generalInfo: HKBU warmly welcomes international students, offering robust support through its International Office for visa processing, orientation, and cultural integration. With a student-faculty ratio of 12:1, personalized learning is prioritized. Graduates enjoy a 95% employment rate within six months, bolstered by career services and global networks. The multicultural campus in bustling Hong Kong provides unparalleled opportunities for internships and experiential learning in Asia's world city.

tagline: Empowering Minds. Shaping Futures.
description: Corvinus University of Budapest, founded in 1920, is Hungary's premier public research university specializing in business, economics, and social sciences. Renowned for its rigorous academic programs and international outlook, it holds prestigious accreditations including AACSB and AMBA. Situated in Budapest's vibrant city center, Corvinus attracts a diverse student body of over 11,500, including more than 2,000 international students, offering degrees from bachelor to doctoral levels in multiple languages, with a strong emphasis on research, innovation, and global employability.

tagline: ज्ञानं परमं ध्येयम् – Knowledge is the Supreme Goal
description: Established in 1958 with UNESCO assistance, IIT Bombay is India’s premier public technical university and a global leader in engineering, science, and innovation. Ranked #1 in India (NIRF 2025), IIT Bombay offers B.Tech, M.Tech, PhD, and dual-degree programs across 17 departments. Located on a 550-acre lakeside campus in Mumbai, it fosters cutting-edge research, entrepreneurship (via SINE), and alumni who lead Google, Microsoft, and Flipkart.

On-campus hostels, 24/7 labs, and Techfest/Mood Indigo (Asia’s largest cultural fest) create a vibrant ecosystem. 95%+ placement rate with average CTC ₹21.8 LPA (₹2.18 million).

tagline: Centre of Excellence for training, research and development in science, engineering and technology
description: Indian Institute of Technology Delhi (IIT Delhi), established in 1961, is a premier public technical university in India renowned for its excellence in engineering, technology, sciences, management, and humanities. Located on a 325-acre campus in New Delhi, it fosters innovation, research, and global leadership, with a vibrant community of students and faculty driving advancements for societal benefit. IIT Delhi has produced over 60,000 alumni who are leaders in industry and academia worldwide.

tagline: Innovation, Knowledge, Career
description: The University of Debrecen, founded in 1538, is Hungary's oldest continuously operating higher education institution and one of its largest universities, with 14 faculties offering over 100 English-taught programs in fields like medicine, engineering, business, IT, agriculture, sciences, humanities, and social sciences. Ranked 574th globally by QS in 2025, it emphasizes research, innovation, and practical training, hosting 28,000 students including 6,000+ internationals from 120 countries, supported by partnerships with global institutions and industry.

International students require B2 English proficiency for undergraduate and C1 for graduate programs, with pathways available via preparatory courses. The university assists with visa processes and offers EU-recognized degrees, enabling alumni to pursue global careers in healthcare, tech, business, and academia through its extensive network.

tagline: Fostering Excellence in Education and Research
description: The University of Delhi (DU), established in 1922 by an Act of the Central Legislative Assembly, is one of India's premier public universities. Beginning with three colleges and 750 students, it has expanded to include 16 faculties, over 80 academic departments, more than 90 colleges, and a student body exceeding 700,000. Renowned for its academic rigor, research contributions, and diverse programs in humanities, sciences, commerce, law, and management, DU emphasizes holistic education and global engagement. Its North and South Campuses in New Delhi host a vibrant, multicultural community with strong industry ties.

generalInfo: The University of Delhi welcomes international students through its Foreign Students' Registry (FSR), providing comprehensive support for admissions, orientation, and cultural adaptation. With a focus on merit-based selection and practical learning, DU graduates boast high employability in India and globally. The dynamic campuses in New Delhi offer access to cultural heritage, internships, and a cost-effective urban lifestyle, though students should prepare for diverse weather and vibrant city energy.

tagline: The Future is Here
description: Atlantic Technological University (ATU), established in 2022, is Ireland's largest multi-campus technological university, serving over 30,000 students across nine campuses in the west and northwest. Offering more than 840 programs from pre-degree to doctoral level, ATU focuses on applied learning, industry collaboration, and regional development. With a diverse student body from 115+ countries, it promotes global citizenship through research, placements, and international partnerships in a stunning coastal setting.

tagline: Transforming Lives and Societies
description: Dublin City University (DCU), established in 1989, is a leading young university in Ireland renowned for its innovative approach to education, research, and industry collaboration. Offering a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs across five faculties including Science and Health, DCU Business School, Engineering and Computing, Humanities and Social Sciences, and the Institute of Education, DCU emphasizes practical learning through initiatives like INTRA internships. With a diverse student body from over 124 countries, DCU fosters global citizenship and ranks #1 in Ireland for graduate employability.

tagline: Nurture tomorrow’s global leaders through Inspirational Learning, Interactive Learning and Innovative Learning
description: City University of Hong Kong (CityU), established in 1984 as City Polytechnic of Hong Kong and granted full university status in 1994, is a leading public research university located in Kowloon, Hong Kong. Renowned for its innovative teaching and research across disciplines including business, engineering, creative media, law, science, and veterinary medicine, CityU emphasizes professional education, global partnerships with over 400 exchange institutions in 44 countries, and real-world experiential learning. It ranks highly internationally, including #1 Most International University by THE 2024 and #62 in QS World University Rankings 2025, preparing students for impactful careers in Asia and beyond.

Small class sizes, state-of-the-art facilities in a vibrant urban campus near MTR Kowloon Tong Station, and strong industry ties ensure a personalized, globally oriented education.

campusName: Francis Street and The Coombe Campuses, Dublin
tagline: Europe's Leading Music College in the Heart of Dublin
stats[2]: Alumni from 50+ Countries, 85% Employed in Industry
description: BIMM Music Institute Dublin, established in 2011 as part of BIMM University, is a premier music education institution offering undergraduate and postgraduate degrees in commercial modern music, music business, and related fields. Validated by Technological University Dublin (TU Dublin), it provides vocational, industry-focused programs with hands-on training in performance, production, and management. Located in Dublin's vibrant Liberties area, BIMM Dublin connects students to Ireland's thriving music scene, boasting alumni like Fontaines D.C. and fostering careers through masterclasses, internships, and live performances.

universityName: Technological University of the Shannon (TUS Limerick)
tagline: Applied Learning. Fresh Thinking.
description: The Technological University of the Shannon (TUS), established in October 2021 through the merger of Limerick Institute of Technology (LIT, founded 1974), Athlone Institute of Technology, and Institute of Technology Tralee, is Ireland's third technological university and the first transregional one. With principal campuses in Limerick (Moylish, Clare Street, Coonagh), it serves over 15,000 students across seven sites in the Midwest and Midlands. Focusing on applied learning, innovation, and industry collaboration, TUS offers undergraduate and postgraduate programs in engineering, business, health sciences, arts, and technology, emphasizing employability, regional development, and inclusivity in a supportive, multi-campus environment.

tagline: Excellence in Education and Research
description: The Indian Institute of Technology Madras (IIT Madras), established in 1959 with assistance from the West German government, is a premier public research university and one of India's Institutes of Eminence. Located on a 620-acre campus adjoining Guindy National Park in Chennai, it offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs across 16 departments in engineering, sciences, humanities, and management. Renowned for innovation, IIT Madras has over 550 faculty, strong industry ties, and global partnerships. It ranks #1 in NIRF Engineering and Overall 2025, #180 in QS World University Rankings 2026 (improved from #227 in 2025), and leads in research with 417 patents filed in 2024-25, preparing students for global leadership.

generalInfo: IIT Madras welcomes international students through dedicated channels like DASA and exchange programs, requiring entrance exams, transcripts, and visa documentation. Emphasizing research, internships, and entrepreneurship via IITMRP, it achieves near-100% placement with average salaries of INR 22 LPA. The green, self-contained campus features world-class labs, libraries, and sports facilities, fostering holistic development in a vibrant, inclusive environment near Chennai's urban hub.

tagline: Discover and Innovate; Transform and Transcend; Serve and Lead
description: The Indian Institute of Science (IISc), founded in 1909, is India's premier public research university located in Bangalore. Spanning over 40 departments and centers, it offers undergraduate (BS Research, BTech), master's (MTech, MDes, MSc), and doctoral programs in sciences, engineering, technology, and management. Renowned for groundbreaking research, innovation, and global collaborations, IISc emphasizes interdisciplinary education, practical training, and high-impact projects, achieving exceptional graduate outcomes and contributions to national development.

The expansive campus supports a dynamic, multicultural environment with over 95% employability, though international applicants should monitor geopolitical travel advisories.

tagline: Make Your Future
description: Dundalk Institute of Technology (DkIT), established in 1971 as a Regional Technical College and upgraded to an Institute of Technology in 1998, is a dynamic public higher education institution in Ireland's northeast. Located on a 90-acre campus in Dundalk along the Dublin-Belfast economic corridor, DkIT serves the North Leinster-South Ulster region with innovative undergraduate, postgraduate, and flexible programs across four schools: Business & Humanities, Engineering, Health & Science, and Informatics & Creative Arts. Home to over 5,400 students including 600+ international from diverse backgrounds, it excels in research areas like ICT, sustainability, and creative industries, fostering employability through industry partnerships, modern facilities, and a commitment to inclusion.

tagline: Modern Business Education That Gets Results
stats[2]: Part of Holmes Education Group (85,000+ Alumni)
description: Holmes Institute Dublin, launched in 2022, is the European flagship of the Holmes Education Group (founded 1963). Housed in elegant Georgian townhouses on historic Merrion Square, HID delivers QQI-validated business degrees with a fresh, industry-led curriculum. Students enjoy mandatory internships, guest lectures from Google & Meta executives, and a 6-month incubator module where they launch real micro-businesses. With an average class of 20 and a 1:12 faculty ratio, every learner receives personalised career coaching.

tagline: The Oldest University in Hungary
description: The University of Pécs (PTE or UP), founded in 1367, is Hungary's oldest university and one of its largest higher education institutions, with over 25,000 students including more than 5,600 international students from 136 countries. Operating 10 faculties and 21 doctoral schools, it offers over 300 programs across sciences, arts, medicine, law, business, and more, with more than 100 in English. As a public benefit organization, PTE emphasizes research, innovation, and internationalization through partnerships worldwide, following the Bologna Process for EU-recognized degrees.

tagline: Excellence in Science, Technology, and Art for Indonesia and the World
description: Institut Teknologi Bandung (ITB), established in 1920 as the Technische Hoogeschool te Bandoeng, is Indonesia's premier public research university specializing in science, engineering, architecture, business, and design. Located in the vibrant city of Bandung, ITB drives innovation and national development through cutting-edge research, international collaborations, and a commitment to sustainability. With a legacy of producing influential alumni in industry, government, and academia, ITB fosters a dynamic, multicultural environment for over 23,000 students.

tagline: Transforming Lives Through Excellence in Education
description: Maynooth University (Ollscoil Mhá Nuad), a constituent university of the National University of Ireland, blends 18th-century heritage with cutting-edge research across Arts, Science, Engineering, and Social Sciences. Located 25 km west of Dublin, its dual North & South campuses host world-class labs (Éolas, Iontas), Europe’s happiest international students (StudyPortals), and a 94% graduate employment rate. Mandatory internships, 300+ global partners, and small-group teaching ensure every student thrives.

With a diverse community of students and faculty from around the world, it fosters an environment of excellence, entrepreneurship, and global impact.

tagline: Your Gateway to Top Hungarian Universities
description: Budapest International College (BIC), established in 2021, is a private foundation college and official admissions office in Hungary, specializing in preparatory programs and facilitating entry into leading Hungarian universities for engineering, IT, and business degrees. As the exclusive partner of institutions like Óbuda University and John von Neumann University, it provides English-taught foundation courses in Business, Management, Mathematics, Physics, and English to equip international students for seamless progression to accredited Bachelor's and Master's programs, emphasizing academic preparation and cultural integration in a supportive environment.

generalInfo: Budapest International College caters to global students seeking entry into Hungarian higher education, offering flexible foundation pathways and comprehensive admission support including visa assistance and housing. With a B2 English requirement assessed via interview, it promotes small-group learning and personalized guidance. Graduates progress to EU-recognized degrees at partner universities, enhancing prospects in tech, engineering, and business through strong industry ties and a vibrant student community from regions including Africa, the Middle East, and Asia.

universityName: National and Kapodistrian University of Athens
campusName: Central Campus (Propylea), Zografou Campus, Goudi (Medical), Daphne (Sciences)
tagline: Greece's Oldest and Most Prestigious University
description: Founded in 1837, the National and Kapodistrian University of Athens (NKUA) is Greece’s flagship institution and the oldest university in Southeast Europe. With 100,000+ students across 33 departments, it excels in medicine, law, humanities, and natural sciences. Home to 2,200 faculty and 1,500+ research labs, NKUA drives 40% of Greece’s research output and partners with Harvard, Oxford, and CERN. Its historic neoclassical campus sits in the heart of Athens, steps from the Acropolis.

location: Pok Fu Lam, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
tagline: Asia's Global University
description: The University of Hong Kong (HKU), founded in 1911, is Hong Kong's oldest and most prestigious public research university. Renowned for its academic excellence and global impact, HKU offers comprehensive programs across 10 faculties, including medicine, law, business, and engineering. With strong international partnerships and a commitment to innovation, it prepares students for leadership roles in a dynamic world, boasting top rankings and a diverse, vibrant community.

tagline: Together We Can
description: Kodolányi János University (KJU), established in 1992, is a state-accredited non-profit private higher education institution in Hungary, with its main campus in Budapest and regional campuses in Székesfehérvár and Orosháza. Offering undergraduate, graduate, and postgraduate programs in English and Hungarian, KJU specializes in business administration, tourism and hospitality, media and communication, informatics, and social sciences. Serving over 3,000 students, it emphasizes practical, e-based learning aligned with EU standards, international partnerships with 150+ institutions across 36 countries, and preparation for careers in the sustainable digital economy.

campusName: Belvedere Place (Main), Mountjoy Square, Dorset Street, ABC Drumcondra
tagline: Your Future Starts Here
description: Dorset College, founded in 1983, is an independent QQI-accredited higher education provider in Dublin city centre. Housed in restored Georgian buildings, it delivers career-focused full-time and part-time programs in Business, Computing & IT, Healthcare, and English Language. Small classes (max 20), mandatory work placements with 500+ industry partners (Google, Meta, Accenture), and a dedicated Student Experience Team ensure every learner leaves job-ready and globally connected.

tagline: Progressive Learning in the North West
description: Letterkenny Institute of Technology (LYIT), established in 1971, was a leading institute of technology in northwest Ireland, offering undergraduate and postgraduate programs in business, engineering, science, computing, design, and tourism. Now integrated into Atlantic Technological University (ATU) since 2022, the Letterkenny campus continues to deliver practical, industry-focused education with strong employer partnerships. Accredited by Quality and Qualifications Ireland (QQI), it emphasizes innovation, research, and regional development, attracting a diverse student body to its vibrant campuses in Letterkenny and Killybegs.

tagline: Inspiring Futures
description: South East Technological University (SETU) Waterford Campus, formerly Waterford Institute of Technology established in 1970, is a dynamic hub of Ireland's newest technological university formed in 2022 through the merger with Institute of Technology Carlow. Located in Waterford, the oldest city in Ireland, the campus offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and research programs across five sub-campuses in business, engineering, science, health sciences, humanities, and computing. Emphasizing innovation, industry partnerships, and sustainability, SETU Waterford serves a diverse international community, fostering regional growth and global opportunities with state-of-the-art facilities like the Walton Institute.

International students benefit from dedicated visa assistance, orientation, and affordable accommodation options.

tagline: American Liberal Arts Education in the Eternal City
description: The American University of Rome (AUR), founded in 1969, is the oldest American-accredited university in Italy, offering undergraduate and graduate degrees in liberal arts, business, communications, international relations, and more. Regionally accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education (MSCHE), AUR provides a rigorous American-style education to a diverse international student body, emphasizing experiential learning, internships, and cultural immersion in historic Rome.

tagline: Igniting Creativity in the Heart of the Renaissance
description: Florence University of the Arts (FUA), established in 1997, is a pioneering private higher education institution in Italy specializing in creative and liberal arts disciplines. Accredited by the Region of Tuscany (Accreditation Number OF0110), FUA offers English-taught programs through its partner The American University of Florence (AUF), providing US-accredited degrees alongside EU-recognized ECTS credits. With a focus on experiential learning, cultural immersion, and community engagement, FUA serves a global student body in the vibrant setting of Florence and Cinque Terre, fostering innovation in fields like fashion, design, hospitality, and sustainability.

tagline: Your Future Starts Here
description: Atlantic Technological University (ATU) Sligo Campus, formerly the Institute of Technology Sligo established in 1970, is a key part of Ireland's newest technological university formed in 2022. Located along the Wild Atlantic Way under Benbulben, the 72-acre green campus offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and online programs in engineering, business, science, design, health, and social sciences. Emphasizing applied learning, innovation, and industry partnerships, ATU Sligo supports nearly 10,000 students with modern facilities, research hubs, and a vibrant community focused on regional development and global opportunities.

tagline: A Private Business School Without Borders
stats[2]: Validated by Richmond, The American International University in London
description: The European School of Economics (ESE), founded in 1994, is a private higher education institution specializing in business education. Fully accredited in the UK by ASIC with Premier status and validated by Richmond, The American International University in London, ESE offers Bachelor’s, Master’s, and MBA programs across its international campuses, including three in Italy. Emphasizing pragmatic, multicultural learning, ESE prepares students for global careers through customized programs, internships, and a focus on personal development in fields like management, finance, and marketing.

tagline: Advancing Mobility and Connectivity Through Education
description: Transport and Telecommunication Institute (TSI), founded in 1999, is a leading private university in Latvia specializing in transport engineering, logistics, IT, and telecommunications. Located in Riga, TSI offers accredited bachelor's, master's, and doctoral programs in English and Latvian, with a strong emphasis on research, international partnerships, and industry placements. Ranked among top Latvian institutions for engineering (QS 2025), TSI collaborates with EU projects and companies like Siemens and Huawei.

tagline: Innovate. Create. Transform.
description: South East Technological University (SETU), established in 2022 through the merger of the Institute of Technology Carlow and Waterford Institute of Technology, is a dynamic technological university serving the south-east region of Ireland. Accredited by Quality and Qualifications Ireland (QQI), SETU offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs across four campuses in Carlow, Waterford, Wexford, and Cork. With a focus on applied learning, industry collaboration, and innovation, SETU prepares students for global careers in fields like engineering, business, health sciences, and creative arts, welcoming a diverse international community.

description: Technological University of the Shannon (TUS), Ireland’s newest TU, was created in October 2021 from the merger of LIT and AIT. Spanning six vibrant campuses along the River Shannon, TUS delivers 250+ career-focused programmes in STEM, Business, Art & Design, Health Sciences and Apprenticeships. With small classes (avg. 25), 1,000+ industry partners and a 95% graduate employment rate, TUS guarantees every student a paid work placement and real-world projects.

tagline: Innovating Art and Design for a Global Future
description: Founded in 1980, Nuova Accademia di Belle Arti (NABA) is Italy's largest private art academy, legally recognized by the Ministry of University and Research (MUR) since 1981. With campuses in Milan and Rome, and a new international campus opening in London in 2026, NABA offers undergraduate and postgraduate degrees equivalent to university levels in Design, Fashion, Media, Graphic Design, Visual Arts, and Textile Design. Ranked in the Top 100 worldwide by QS World University Rankings for Art & Design, NABA emphasizes contemporary artistic practice, interdisciplinary approaches, and strong industry partnerships to foster creative professionals in a multicultural environment.

tagline: Knowledge, Wisdom, Freedom
description: The American University of Central Asia (AUCA), founded in 1993, is a private, non-profit liberal arts university in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan. Partnering with Bard College for US-accredited degrees, it offers undergraduate and graduate programs in fields like business administration, economics, journalism, software engineering, psychology, and Central Asian studies. Emphasizing democratic values, critical inquiry, and academic freedom, AUCA fosters a diverse, international community with over 300 international students, preparing leaders for regional and global impact through practical training and research.

tagline: Discover Excellence – Asia’s #1 University
description: The University of Tokyo (Todai) is Japan’s most prestigious university and a global leader in research. Home to 10 Nobel laureates, it offers English-taught programs (PEAK, G30, Global Science) alongside traditional Japanese tracks. Located in the world’s largest metropolis, students access Sony, Toyota, and SoftBank internships within 15 minutes.

tagline: Empowering Digital Leaders Through Innovation
description: Domain Academy, founded in 2016, is a private Maltese institution specializing in technology, business, and digital media education. It delivers UK-validated degrees in partnership with the University of Central Lancashire (UCLan) and offers programs in cybersecurity, data science, and entrepreneurship. Accredited by the Malta Further and Higher Education Authority (MFHEA), Domain emphasizes practical training, industry placements, and EU-recognized qualifications in a multicultural environment.

tagline: Fresh Thinking. Applied Learning.
description: Technological University Dublin (TU Dublin), established in 2019 as Ireland's first Technological University through the merger of three historic institutions, is a dynamic public higher education provider with over 28,500 students across five campuses in Dublin. Offering a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and research programs in areas like engineering, business, computing, design, health sciences, and creative arts, TU Dublin emphasizes applied learning, innovation, and industry collaboration. Accredited by Quality and Qualifications Ireland (QQI), it fosters an inclusive, multicultural environment with strong support for international students, preparing graduates for global careers through practical skills and vibrant campus life.

universityName: Latvia University of Life Sciences and Technologies
tagline: Innovations for Sustainable Bioeconomy
description: Latvia University of Life Sciences and Technologies (LBTU), founded in 1863, is the leading public university in Latvia specializing in bioeconomy, agriculture, forestry, veterinary medicine, and environmental sciences. Renowned for its research-driven education and international collaborations, LBTU ranks in the global 1501+ (THE 2025) and hosts students from over 50 countries. With modern facilities and strong industry ties, it prepares graduates for sustainable development in the Baltic region and beyond.

campusName: Casale di San Pio V Campus
tagline: Qualifying You for a Global Career
description: Link Campus University, founded in 1999 as a subsidiary of the University of Malta and recognized as an independent Italian university in 2011, is a private higher education institution located in a historic complex in Rome. Accredited by the Italian Ministry of Education, University and Research (MIUR) under Decree No. 374, it offers English-taught bachelor's and master's programs in fields like international management, media, politics, and finance. Emphasizing an interdisciplinary, multicultural approach blending English and Italian educational methods, LCU prepares students for global careers through innovative teaching, industry partnerships, and a vibrant international community.

tagline: Aut viam inveniam aut faciam!
description: L.N. Gumilyov Eurasian National University (ENU), founded in 1996, is a leading public research university in Astana, Kazakhstan, serving as an academic, research, social, and cultural center. It offers comprehensive programs in humanities, social sciences, natural sciences, engineering, and military science across undergraduate and graduate levels. With a focus on Eurasian studies and international collaboration, ENU promotes innovation, multilingual education, and global partnerships, preparing over 17,000 students for leadership roles in a dynamic region.

universityName: Kyrgyz National University named after Jusup Balasagyn
tagline: Building Knowledge Societies Through Excellence in Education
description: Kyrgyz National University named after Jusup Balasagyn (KNU), founded in 1925, is the oldest and largest public higher education institution in Kyrgyzstan. Located in the capital city of Bishkek, KNU comprises 19 faculties and 61 academic departments offering a wide range of undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs in fields such as humanities, natural sciences, social sciences, medicine, law, economics, and philology. With a commitment to research innovation and international collaboration, KNU serves over 26,000 students, including a growing number of internationals, and emphasizes affordable, quality education in a multicultural environment.

tagline: Empowering Learners Worldwide
description: Advenio eAcademy, established in 2013, is a pioneering private higher education institution in Malta specializing in online and blended learning programs. Licensed by the Malta Further and Higher Education Authority (MFHEA, Licence 2013-FHI-006), it offers EU-recognized qualifications in entrepreneurship, business, management, and related fields through its award-winning EBLearn platform. Catering to a global audience, it fosters flexible, student-centric education with collaborations across HEIs, NGOs, and industry partners for practical, accredited outcomes.

tagline: An American University in Rome
description: John Cabot University, established in 1972, is a private American liberal arts university in Rome, Italy, offering undergraduate and graduate degrees in business, arts, humanities, and social sciences. Accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education (MSCHE), it provides an American-style education to a diverse student body from over 75 countries, with small classes, international faculty, and emphasis on internships and global citizenship in the historic Trastevere neighborhood.

tagline: Tomorrow’s Leaders, Today
description: Luiss Guido Carli – Libera Università Internazionale degli Studi Sociali – is an independent private university founded in 1974 and fully refurbished in 2007. With four departments (Business & Management, Economics & Finance, Law, Political Science) and four postgraduate Schools, Luiss specialises in Social Sciences and trains tomorrow’s leaders in Rome. All programs are taught in English, small classes (max 35), mandatory internships with 2,500+ partners, and a 95% graduate employment rate within 12 months.

tagline: Where Finbarr Taught, Let Munster Learn
description: University College Cork (UCC), founded in 1845, is a globally recognised public research university and a constituent college of the National University of Ireland. Set on a stunning riverside campus in Ireland’s second city, UCC excels in Medicine, Pharmacy, Law, Business, Food Science, and Humanities. With 4 Nobel laureates, a 98% graduate employment rate, and €100M+ annual research funding, UCC delivers world-class education through small-group teaching, 400+ industry placements, and cutting-edge facilities like the €70M ASSERT medical simulation centre.

tagline: Change Lives Through Education
description: Established in 1951, National College of Ireland (NCI) is a dynamic higher education institution in Dublin, specializing in business, computing, psychology, and education. Accredited by Quality and Qualifications Ireland (QQI), NCI offers a range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and higher diploma programs to over 6,000 students from more than 120 nationalities. Emphasizing practical skills, industry partnerships, and employability, NCI is located in the heart of Dublin's International Financial Services Centre, providing students with access to global opportunities and a vibrant urban environment.

universityName: Trinity College Dublin, the University of Dublin
tagline: Ireland's University on the World Stage
description: Trinity College Dublin, founded in 1592 by Queen Elizabeth I as Ireland's oldest university, is a world-renowned public institution in the heart of Dublin. Home to 22,000 students across faculties of Arts & Humanities, Engineering & Systems Sciences, Science & Health, and Social Sciences & Law, it excels in research, innovation, and interdisciplinary education. Famous for landmarks like the Book of Kells and Long Room Library, Trinity fosters a vibrant international community, blending historic tradition with cutting-edge facilities to prepare graduates for global leadership.

campusName: KazGUGrad Campus (62 hectares) + Keremet Student City
tagline: Leading the Nation – Shaping the Future
description: Al-Farabi Kazakh National University (KazNU), founded in 1934, is Kazakhstan’s oldest and highest-ranked public research university. Named after the medieval philosopher Al-Farabi, it hosts 16 faculties and 67 departments, offering 300+ programs in Kazakh, Russian, and English. With 150+ global partners (including Sorbonne, MIT, and Tsinghua), a UNESCO Chair, and a 62-hectare mountain-view campus, KazNU produces presidents, cosmonauts, and Nobel nominees.

tagline: Internationalizing Professional Training for Global Careers
description: The International Academy of Naples (IAN), established in 2018, is a private higher education institution in Naples, Italy, dedicated to the internationalization of professional training aligned with global standards. As a member of the European Federation of Schools (FEDE) since 2021, it offers accredited European Bachelor and Master programs in fields such as business administration, design, tourism, IT, and professional arts. With a focus on practical skills, innovation, and new technologies, IAN prepares students for transformative careers through a blend of theoretical and hands-on learning in a multicultural environment.

campusName: Waterford, Carlow, Wexford, Wicklow, Kilkenny Campuses
tagline: Inspiring Futures
description: South East Technological University (SETU), established in 2022 through the merger of Waterford Institute of Technology and Institute of Technology Carlow, is Ireland's newest technological university serving the southeast region. Offering undergraduate, postgraduate, and research programs in business, engineering, science, health, humanities, and more, SETU emphasizes applied learning, industry partnerships, and innovation. With campuses across Waterford, Carlow, Wexford, Wicklow, and Kilkenny, it fosters a dynamic environment for over 18,000 students from more than 100 countries, promoting global engagement and regional development.

International students receive dedicated support for visas, orientation, and wellbeing in Ireland's welcoming southeast.

tagline: Shaping a Better World
description: University of Galway, established in 1845, is Ireland's #1 university for sustainable development and a top 3 in Europe, ranked 284 globally by QS. As part of the ENLIGHT European University Alliance, it offers over 50 undergraduate and 200+ postgraduate programs in arts, humanities, business, law, science, engineering, medicine, health sciences, and nursing. Committed to research-led excellence, innovation, and global challenges, it invests €80m annually in research and €334m in facilities since 2010, fostering a vibrant community on a beautiful coastal campus.

tagline: Developing Potential
description: Tio University of Applied Sciences, founded in 1969, is a private institution specializing in small-scale, intensive education in business-related fields. With campuses across the Netherlands, it offers English-taught Bachelor's, Associate, and Master's programs in hospitality, tourism, international business, and management. Recognized by NVAO for quality, Tio emphasizes practical projects, internships, and international exchanges, preparing students for global careers in dynamic industries.

tagline: Knowledge Without Borders

It comprises 10 faculties offering a wide array of programs in humanities, sciences, economics, law, and management. Ranked among Poland's top universities, it emphasizes interdisciplinary research and international collaboration, hosting students from over 40 countries and fostering innovation through partnerships with regional industries and EU-funded projects.

tagline: Innovation with Impact

It offers British-accredited degrees in business, engineering, IT, and design, with a focus on employability and industry collaboration. Ranked highly for student satisfaction, CUW attracts a diverse international community from over 30 countries and partners with global firms for practical training and internships.

campusName: Main Campus, Peterhof Campus, Multiple Campuses
tagline: Hic tuta perennat (Here all in safety lasts)
description: Saint Petersburg State University (SPbU), founded in 1724, is one of Russia's oldest and most prestigious public research universities, located in Saint Petersburg. It offers over 500 programs across sciences, humanities, social sciences, engineering, medicine, law, and more, emphasizing research excellence, innovation, and international collaboration. With a rich history and modern facilities, SPbU prepares students for global leadership through a vibrant academic community and cultural immersion.

tagline: Academic Curiosity Meets Societal Impact
description: Radboud University, founded in 1923 as the Catholic University of Nijmegen, is a leading public research university in the Netherlands. Located in the vibrant city of Nijmegen, it excels in interdisciplinary research and education across seven faculties, emphasizing sustainability, health sciences, and social innovation. Ranked in the global top 150 (QS 2025), Radboud hosts students from over 100 countries and fosters strong ties with global partners for collaborative projects and exchanges.
