universityName: Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology (MIPT)
tagline: Sapere aude (Dare to know)
description: The Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology (MIPT), established in 1946, is a leading public research university in Russia, often called the "Russian MIT." Located in Dolgoprudny near Moscow, it specializes in physics, mathematics, engineering, computer science, and biotechnology through its unique Phystech System of education. With a highly selective admission process (under 4% for internationals), MIPT emphasizes rigorous theoretical training, research, and industry partnerships, producing Nobel laureates and top scientists while fostering innovation and global collaborations.

tagline: Global Education, Local Impact
description: Webster University Leiden, established in 1981, is the European campus of the private American Webster University (St. Louis, USA). It offers a diverse range of undergraduate and graduate programs in business, media, international relations, and psychology, all taught in English. Accredited by the Higher Learning Commission (USA) and NVAO (Netherlands), it emphasizes global citizenship and experiential learning, with small class sizes and study abroad opportunities.

tagline: Global Education with American Standards
description: International American University (IAU), founded in 2009, is a private institution in the US Virgin Islands offering flexible online and on-campus programs in business, IT, healthcare, and education. Accredited by the Distance Education Accrediting Commission (DEAC) and approved by the USVI Department of Education, IAU focuses on accessible, career-oriented degrees with international faculty and a diverse student body from 50+ countries.

tagline: Digitalisation for Sustainable Development
description: The University of Skövde, founded in 1977 and granted university status in 1983, is a public university in Skövde, Sweden. Known for its focus on digitalisation and sustainability, it offers specialised programs in game development, bioinformatics, and health sciences. With a modern campus and strong industry ties through initiatives like Sweden Game Arena, it fosters innovation and employability for its 9,000 students.

tagline: Developing People to Their True Potential
description: Global College Malta (GCM), established in 2012, is a leading private higher education institution in Malta, offering European-accredited degrees in business, management, and related fields. Located in the innovative SmartCity Malta hub, GCM provides undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs validated by the Malta Further and Higher Education Authority (MFHEA, Licence No. 2012-TC-005). With partnerships to prestigious British universities like the University of Chester, GCM emphasizes industry-relevant education, preparing students for global careers through practical skills and cross-cultural experiences.

tagline: Scientia est Potentia – Knowledge is Power
description: Lomonosov Moscow State University (MSU), founded in 1755 by Mikhail Lomonosov, is Russia’s oldest, largest, and most prestigious public research university. The iconic Stalinist skyscraper on Sparrow Hills houses 40 faculties and 15 research institutes, offering 400+ programs in Russian and English. With 11 Nobel laureates among alumni and faculty, partnerships with CERN, NASA, and Tsinghua, MSU remains a global leader in physics, mathematics, and space science.

universityName: Global School for Entrepreneurship, University of Applied Sciences
tagline: Igniting Entrepreneurial Minds for a Global Future
description: The Global School for Entrepreneurship (GSE), part of the Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences, was established in 2013 to foster innovative entrepreneurs. Located in the heart of Amsterdam, GSE offers a unique Bachelor's in International Entrepreneurship, emphasizing real-world projects, startup incubation, and global networking. Accredited by NVAO, it ranks highly for employability and innovation in Dutch higher education (Keuzegids 2025).

campusName: Tromsø Campus, Alta Campus, Hammerfest Campus, Harstad Campus
tagline: Innovation at the Top of the World
description: UiT The Arctic University of Norway, established in 1968, is the world's northernmost university and the largest higher education institution in Northern Norway. It offers a wide range of bachelor's, master's, and PhD programs in English and Norwegian, with strengths in Arctic and climate research, health sciences, humanities, social sciences, law, economics, and engineering. With 16,650 students and 3,500 staff, UiT fosters interdisciplinary collaboration and global partnerships, contributing to sustainable development in the polar regions.

The vibrant, multicultural community in Tromsø offers unique opportunities for northern lights viewing and outdoor adventures.

tagline: Kick-start your career at Norway’s leading triple accredited business school
description: The Norwegian School of Economics (NHH), founded in 1936 as Norway's first business school, is the leading institution for management and business administration education and research. Located in Bergen, it offers programs in economics, business analysis, marketing, international business, energy, natural resources, and the environment, with strong ties to the business community and global networks like CEMS.

tagline: Integration of Education and Science
description: Novosibirsk State University (NSU), founded in 1959 as part of the Akademgorodok scientific hub under the Siberian Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences, is a leading public research university in Russia. Located in the innovative Akademgorodok district of Novosibirsk, NSU integrates education with cutting-edge research across 13 departments in natural sciences, mathematics, humanities, economics, and social sciences. It emphasizes early student involvement in research and collaboration with over 200 global partners. Ranked #=461 in QS World University Rankings 2026, #961 globally by EduRank 2025, and #869 in US News Best Global Universities, NSU has around 2,000 international students from 70+ countries and produces graduates with a 95% employment rate within six months.

With 31 English-taught programs and Russian preparatory courses, NSU focuses on research-driven education, internships in Akademgorodok labs, and exchanges. It achieves a 95% graduate employment rate via career services and industry ties. The 200-hectare forested campus offers modern facilities, dorms 3 minutes from classes, sports complexes, and cultural events, fostering a vibrant, multicultural environment in Siberia's scientific capital.

tagline: Empowering Global Leaders
description: Global Banking School Malta (GBS Malta), established in 2021 as part of the UK-based Global Banking School, is a private higher education institution specializing in business, finance, and management programs. Located in the heart of Msida, it delivers top-up Bachelor's and Master's degrees validated by Leeds Beckett University and the University of Central Lancashire. With a focus on practical, industry-aligned education, GBS Malta supports international students through flexible delivery modes, including blended learning, and strong career services.

tagline: Ideas into Action
description: Inter College Business School (ICBS), founded in 1979, is a private institution specializing in practical, entrepreneurial business education. Located in the heart of Amsterdam, it offers a Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) program designed for aspiring entrepreneurs. Accredited by the Netherlands-Flanders Accreditation Organisation (NVAO, valid until 2025) and holding the NRTO Quality Mark, ICBS emphasizes hands-on learning and industry connections, with a 100% employment rate for graduates since 2012.

Fully accredited by the Dutch-Flemish Accreditation Organisation (NVAO), Wittenborg ranks among the top applied sciences universities in the Netherlands for internationalization and employability.

tagline: Innovating today… shaping tomorrow
description: Hamad Bin Khalifa University (HBKU), founded in 2010 as part of Qatar Foundation, is a public research university in Doha's Education City. It offers undergraduate and graduate programs across seven colleges, focusing on interdisciplinary education in Islamic studies, humanities, science and engineering, health and life sciences, law, public policy, and business. Committed to innovation and global impact, HBKU emphasizes research, leadership, and community engagement, preparing students for transformative careers with strong employability and international collaborations.

universityName: eie European Business School (formerly European Institute of Education)
campusName: St. Julians Main Campus, Valletta Facilities
tagline: Excellence in Business Education
description: The eie European Business School (formerly European Institute of Education), established in 2000, is a private higher education institution specializing in business, management, hospitality, and related fields. Located in the vibrant coastal town of St. Julians, it offers flexible programs from foundation to master's level, accredited by the Malta Further and Higher Education Authority (MFHEA, Licence No. 2005-TC-001). With a focus on practical skills and international partnerships, eie prepares students for global careers, attracting a diverse cohort from Europe, Asia, and beyond.

campusName: Nygård Campus, Fantoft Campus, Årstad Campus
tagline: Research Excellence in a Coastal City
description: The University of Bergen (UiB), founded in 1946, is Norway's second-oldest university and a leading public research institution. Spanning seven faculties, it offers comprehensive programs in humanities, sciences, medicine, law, and more, with a strong focus on marine and climate research. Home to over 1,600 international students from 100+ countries, UiB emphasizes interdisciplinary innovation and global partnerships, consistently ranking in the top 200 worldwide.

universityName: University of Economics and Human Sciences in Warsaw
campusName: Main Campus (Warsaw), Branch Campuses (Rzeszów, Tarnów, Mielec)
tagline: Knowledge for Your Success
description: The University of Economics and Human Sciences in Warsaw (UEHS), founded in 2001, is a private higher education institution specializing in economics, management, finance, law, psychology, pedagogy, and English studies. Located in Warsaw, it offers modern programs in Polish and English, emphasizing practical skills and international perspectives. UEHS is accredited by the Polish Accreditation Committee (PKA) and recognized for its dynamic teaching methods and strong employability outcomes, with over 100 study programs across bachelors, masters, and doctoral levels.

Its graduates hold positions in multinational corporations, public administration, and NGOs across Europe.

tagline: High Tech, Human Touch
description: The University of Twente (UT), founded in 1961, is a leading public research university in Enschede, Netherlands, renowned for its innovative fusion of technology, engineering, and social sciences. As the only true campus university in the country, UT emphasizes interdisciplinary education and entrepreneurship, ranking in the global top 200 (QS 2025). With five faculties and over 1,200 startups spawned, it attracts students from 100+ nationalities, fostering real-world impact through cutting-edge labs and global partnerships.

universityName: University of Information Technology and Management (WSIiZ)
tagline: Education for Your Future
description: Founded in 1996, the University of Information Technology and Management (WSIiZ) in Rzeszów is the largest non-public university in Poland’s Podkarpackie region. With over 5,000 students, including nearly 1,500 international students from over 40 countries, WSIiZ offers 16 fields of study in Polish and English across four faculties: Medicine, Management, Applied IT, and Media and Social Communication. Known for its practical, industry-aligned education, WSIiZ emphasizes Work Integrated Learning (WIL) and boasts a 92% graduate employment rate, supported by partnerships with companies like Cisco, Microsoft, and G2A. The university also offers doctoral programs and is highly ranked for its multicultural community and English-taught programs.

tagline: Norway's Leading Research University
description: The University of Oslo (UiO), founded in 1811 as Norway’s oldest and highest-ranked university, is a global leader in climate, peace, and life sciences. With 28,000 students from 100+ countries, UiO offers 100+ English-taught Master’s programs and a tuition-free model for all. Its 750+ research groups, partnerships with Oxford, Stanford, and CERN, and 1.2 billion NOK annual research budget drive innovation in a sustainable, inclusive Nordic setting.

tagline: Studies. Work. Life. We Choose Everything!
description: Founded in 1994 as the Poznań School of Banking, WSB Merito University Group is Poland’s largest group of private universities, operating in 11 cities: Bydgoszcz, Chorzów, Gdańsk, Gdynia, Łódź, Opole, Poznań, Szczecin, Toruń, Warsaw, and Wrocław. With over 600,000 students and alumni, it offers 290+ accredited programs, emphasizing practical education, industry partnerships, and flexible schedules. Renowned for its 98.6% graduate satisfaction rate and 86% of students combining work and study, WSB Merito prepares students for careers through internships and modern facilities like 5G labs.

tagline: Qatar University, Changing for You
description: Qatar University (QU), established in 1973 as the College of Education and expanded to a full university in 1977, is Qatar's national university and a leading public research institution. Located on a 242-hectare campus in Doha, QU comprises eight colleges offering over 80 undergraduate and graduate programs in fields like arts, sciences, business, engineering, law, medicine, pharmacy, and sharia. With a diverse student body from 52 nationalities (65% Qatari), QU emphasizes research in environment, energy, and sustainable development, supported by global partnerships and facilities like the Central Library. Ranked #1 in Qatar, 601-650 in THE World University Rankings 2025, and 1060th globally by EduRank 2025, QU fosters innovation and cultural integration.

The modern Doha campus offers state-of-the-art labs, libraries, sports facilities, and cultural centers, ensuring a supportive, multicultural environment with high accessibility and career services.

tagline: Knowledge for a Better World
description: The Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU), established in 1996, is Norway's largest public research university headquartered in Trondheim with additional campuses in Gjøvik and Ålesund. Specializing in technology, natural sciences, engineering, architecture, medicine, and humanities, NTNU offers 379 study programs to over 43,000 students, including 9% international from diverse backgrounds. It emphasizes innovation, sustainability, and interdisciplinary research through extensive labs and industry partnerships.

tagline: Advancing Science, Shaping Futures
description: Founded in 1477, Uppsala University is Sweden’s oldest university and a globally recognized research institution, ranked among the top 100 worldwide. With 11 campuses, including a branch in Visby, Gotland, it offers over 120 master’s and 5 bachelor’s programs in English, spanning medicine, sciences, humanities, and social sciences. Known for eight Nobel laureates, Uppsala fosters cutting-edge research and a vibrant student life with 13 historic student nations.

tagline: Science and Education for Sustainable Life
description: The Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences (SLU), established in 1977, is a leading public institution dedicated to the sustainable use of biological natural resources. With campuses in Uppsala, Alnarp, Umeå, and Skara, it offers innovative programs in agriculture, forestry, veterinary medicine, and environmental sciences. Serving 12,600 FTE students and employing 3,261 staff, SLU drives research and education for global sustainability challenges.

tagline: Integrating Theory and Practice for Sustainable Development
description: Kristianstad University (HKR), founded in 1977 with roots tracing back to 1835, is a public university in southern Sweden. Renowned for its work-integrated learning model unique in Sweden, it emphasizes practical education and internationalization. With around 14,000 students, HKR offers programs in health sciences, business, engineering, and education, fostering strong ties with local industries and global partners through alliances like COLOURS European University.

tagline: Excellence in Education, Inspired by Values
description: Founded in 1973 by the San Pablo CEU Foundation, Universitat Abat Oliba CEU (UAO CEU) is a private, Catholic university in Barcelona, officially recognized in 2003 by the Catalan Parliament. Located in the Sarrià-Sant Gervasi district, it offers personalized education across three faculties: Law and Business; Communication, Education, and Humanities; and Health and Life Sciences/Psychology. Known for its 95.3% graduate employability rate and bilingual programs, UAO CEU emphasizes academic excellence, international mobility, and professional development.

tagline: Called to Freedom
description: UCAM Catholic University of Murcia, founded in 1996, is a private Catholic university in south-eastern Spain, owned by the San Antonio University Foundation. Affiliated with the Roman Catholic Diocese of Cartagena, it emphasizes teaching, research, and evangelization with a strong focus on internationalisation and sports. Offering over 50 degrees across faculties like Law, Business, Medicine, and Sports, it serves 21,386 students, including 3,000 international ones from 115 countries. Renowned for its Olympic medalist alumni and partnerships with clubs like UCAM Murcia CB, it promotes ethical, practical education in a historic monastery setting.

generalInfo: UCAM welcomes international students from over 115 countries, with applications processed via email or portal requiring transcripts, language proof, and financial docs. With 86% graduate employability and personalized tutoring, it partners with global institutions and supports sports excellence. Murcia offers affordable living (~€500/month) and vibrant culture, ideal for a balanced student life.

tagline: The First Private University in the Valencian Community
description: CEU Cardenal Herrera University (CEU UCH), established in 1999 as part of the CEU Foundation, is a private Catholic university in the Valencian Community, Spain. It pioneered private higher education in the region, offering innovative programs with a focus on internationalization and employability. With over 10,000 students from more than 90 countries, it provides degrees in health sciences, architecture, business, communication, and law across three campuses in Valencia, Elche, and Castellón, emphasizing practical training and global partnerships.

universityName: C3S Business School (Castelldefels School of Social Sciences)
tagline: Achieving Dreams Through Higher Education
description: C3S Business School, established in 2014, is a private business school in Barcelona, Spain, registered with the Spanish Ministry of Education. Specializing in pragmatic, assignment-based learning, it offers internationally accredited programs in English across business management, tourism, IT, and administration. With over 90% international students from more than 30 countries, the school emphasizes innovation, diversity, and real-world application through partnerships with UK institutions like NCC Education and OTHM.

tagline: International Business School Championing Innovation
description: EAE Business School, founded in 1958, is a leading private business school with campuses in Barcelona and Madrid, Spain. It offers a wide range of undergraduate, master's, MBA, and postgraduate programs in business administration, international business, marketing, finance, and more. Known for its practical approach, international focus, and strong employability outcomes, EAE serves approximately 3,000 students and boasts over 65,000 alumni worldwide, emphasizing innovation and global leadership.

tagline: Expanding knowledge for sustainable development
description: The University of Maribor, established in 1975, is Slovenia's second-largest and second-oldest university, located in the vibrant city of Maribor. Comprising 17 faculties, it offers over 179 undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs across diverse fields including engineering, business, medicine, law, arts, and sciences. Renowned for its commitment to research, innovation, and international collaboration, the university emphasizes practical learning through internships, industry partnerships, and global exchanges, achieving high graduate employability rates in a supportive, multicultural environment.

campusName: Las Lagunillas Campus, Linares Scientific-Technological Campus
tagline: Driving the Future of Andalucía
description: The University of Jaén (UJA), established in 1993, is a public research university in Jaén, Andalucía, Spain. With a history tracing back to the 14th century, UJA operates two main campuses in Jaén and Linares, plus an affiliated center in Úbeda. Known for its commitment to innovation, sustainability, and internationalisation, it serves over 14,000 students with a focus on research excellence, ranking in the top 50 young universities globally (THE 2023).

tagline: Educating Future Leaders in Tourism and Hospitality
description: Ostelea - School of Tourism & Hospitality, founded in 2000 as part of Planeta Formación y Universidades, is a leading private institution specializing in tourism, hospitality, and event management. With campuses in Barcelona and Madrid, it offers official and institutional programs in English and Spanish, emphasizing practical skills, innovation, and sustainability. Serving over 1,500 students annually from more than 100 nationalities, Ostelea partners with EAE Business School and universities like Universitat de Lleida for triple qualifications.

tagline: Official Online Degrees Affiliated with the University of Barcelona
description: The Centro Universitario Internacional de Barcelona (UNIBA), established in 2014 through a partnership between the University of Barcelona and Grupo Planeta, is a specialized center offering official online undergraduate and graduate degrees. Focused on high-demand fields, it delivers programs in Spanish with the academic rigor and faculty of UB, utilizing innovative virtual learning methodologies. As part of UB's ecosystem, UNIBA serves international students, particularly from Spanish-speaking countries, with flexible, practical education adapted to the Bologna Process.

tagline: Educating Critical Thinkers for Sustainable Development
description: The University of Ljubljana (UL), established in 1919, is Slovenia's oldest and largest higher education and scientific research institution. Comprising 23 faculties and three art academies, it serves over 43,000 students, including around 2,000 internationals. Renowned for its contributions to humanities, social sciences, natural sciences, medicine, engineering, and arts, UL emphasizes innovative research, international collaboration, and sustainable development. Its campuses blend historic architecture with modern facilities in the vibrant capital of Ljubljana, fostering a dynamic academic community.

tagline: A creative and international knowledge environment promoting curiosity, creativity, companionship and utility
description: Linnaeus University, established in 2010 through the merger of Växjö University and Kalmar University, is a modern public university in southern Sweden. With campuses in Växjö and Kalmar, it offers around 200 degree programmes and 1,500 single-subject courses. Known for its focus on sustainable societal development and innovation, it excels in areas such as bioscience, big data, ecology, and humanities. Serving over 40,000 students, including 2,000 international ones, it fosters a vibrant, nature-rich environment with strong industry ties and global partnerships.

tagline: A private Business School without borders, multicultural and pragmatic
description: The European School of Economics (ESE), founded in 1994 in Italy and established in Madrid in 2010, is a private international business school authorized by the Spanish Ministry of Education to award UK-validated degrees. Accredited by ASIC with Premier status and validated by Richmond, The American International University in London, ESE emphasizes practical business education through mandatory internships with over 1,500 global partners and seamless campus transfers. Serving a diverse student body from over 100 countries, it offers bachelor's, master's, and MBA programs in key business disciplines, fostering leadership and innovation in a multicultural environment.

tagline: Make An Impact
description: ESEI International Business School, founded in 1989, is a boutique private institution in Barcelona specializing in business education with a global focus. Accredited by UCAM (Spain's #2 private university) and Collège de Paris (official French degrees), it offers English-taught Bachelor's, Master's, and MBA programs in areas like international business, digital marketing, sports management, and innovation. With 95% international students from 50+ countries and a total enrollment of around 1,000, ESEI emphasizes project-based learning, internships, and humanistic values for real-world impact, achieving 90% employment within 6 months.

tagline: Ad utrumque (Prepared for both)
description: Lund University, founded in 1666, is one of Scandinavia's oldest and top 100 global universities (QS 75 in 2025), with 47,000 students (25% international) across Lund, Helsingborg, and Malmö campuses. Known for its strong research focus (70% of funding), interdisciplinary programs, and global collaborations with over 560 partner universities, it offers over 140 English-taught degrees in areas like engineering, medicine, law, and sustainability. The university fosters innovation and critical thinking in a vibrant, student-centered environment.

tagline: Shape the Digital Future
description: Barcelona Technology School (BTS), founded in 2014, is a private, industry-focused postgraduate institution located in Barcelona’s 22@ innovation district. It offers 14 English-taught Master’s programs in digital transformation, AI, UX/UI, web development, data science, and digital business. All degrees are awarded in partnership with the University of Barcelona (UB), ensuring official recognition. With 90% international students from 50+ countries, BTS delivers project-based learning, mandatory industry internships, and a 95% employment rate within 6 months of graduation. Partners include Google, Amazon, Microsoft, and startups in the Barcelona tech ecosystem.

generalInfo: BTS targets ambitious digital professionals and entrepreneurs. Applications are accepted year-round via the online portal, with 3 intakes (October, February, April). No application fee. The admissions process includes a CV review, motivation letter, English test, and a 15-minute video interview. BTS provides full visa support, health insurance, and housing assistance. Barcelona ranks #1 in Europe for startup ecosystems and offers 300+ sunny days, beaches, and world-class events like Mobile World Congress.

universityName: ETH Zurich (Swiss Federal Institute of Technology)
tagline: Where the Future Begins
description: ETH Zurich, founded in 1855 by the Swiss Confederation, is one of the world’s leading universities in science and technology. Home to Albert Einstein and 21 Nobel Prize winners, it offers rigorous, research-driven programs in engineering, natural sciences, architecture, mathematics, and management. With 40% international students from 120+ countries and partnerships with MIT, Imperial College, and TU Munich, ETH prepares global innovators in state-of-the-art labs and spin-off hubs.

tagline: Learn by Doing
description: Universidad Europea, founded in 1995, is a leading private university in Spain with campuses in Madrid (Villaviciosa de Odón and Alcobendas), Valencia, Alicante, and the Canary Islands. Ranked 1001-1200 in THE World University Rankings 2024, it hosts over 16,000 students (25% international from 100+ countries) and offers 200+ English-taught programs in health sciences, business, engineering, design, and sports. Part of Laureate International Universities, it emphasizes experiential learning, employability (90% placement within 12 months), and innovation through facilities like simulated hospitals and entrepreneurship hubs.

tagline: Excellence in Research and Teaching
description: Pompeu Fabra University (UPF), founded in 1990 and named after the linguist Pompeu Fabra, is a public research university in Barcelona, Spain. Recognized as one of Europe's top young universities, it excels in social sciences, humanities, health sciences, and communication. With over 12,000 students and 1,500 faculty, UPF ranks #1 in Spain and top 10 in Europe under 50 years old by Times Higher Education. It offers bilingual (Catalan/Spanish) and English-taught programs with strong international focus.

tagline: Work Integrated Learning for a Sustainable Future
description: Founded in 1990, University West (Högskolan Väst) is a public university college in Trollhättan, Sweden, known for its pioneering approach to Work Integrated Learning (WIL). Offering over 40 programs, it collaborates closely with industry to provide practical, career-focused education. With a modern campus and a diverse community, it supports over 13,000 students in fields like IT, engineering, and social sciences, fostering innovation and societal impact.

tagline: Transform Your Passion into Your Profession
description: Established in 2011, U-tad (University Center for Technology and Digital Art) is a private university in Las Rozas, Madrid, specializing in digital arts, animation, video games, and computer science. With an industry-focused curriculum, students work on real-world projects using cutting-edge technology alongside professionals from leading companies. U-tad boasts a 92% graduate employment rate, strong industry connections, and a modern campus designed for innovation in the digital industry.

tagline: Enabling Students to Make a Difference
description: Dalarna University, founded in 1977, is a public higher education institution in central Sweden with campuses in Falun and Borlänge. Renowned for flexible online and hybrid learning, it offers programs in business, engineering, health sciences, education, and social sciences. With 17,430 students and 746 staff, it emphasizes applied research, employer collaborations, and sustainable development to foster employability and regional innovation.

tagline: Making a Difference – Since 1994
description: Jönköping University (JU) is a young, entrepreneurial university founded in 1994, ranked among the top 10 universities in Sweden for international student satisfaction. With 12,000 students (1,800 international from 80+ countries), JU is organized into four schools: Jönköping International Business School (AACSB/EQUIS), School of Engineering, School of Education & Communication, and School of Health & Welfare. Located on a green lakeside campus, it boasts Sweden’s strongest student entrepreneurship ecosystem (Science Park, JU Solar Team, Dreamcraft).

tagline: Transforming the World Through Knowledge Transfer
description: UIC Barcelona, founded in 1997, is a private Catholic university in Barcelona, Spain, recognized by the Parliament of Catalonia. With two campuses in Barcelona and Sant Cugat, it serves over 7,000 students from more than 99 countries, emphasizing personalized education, research, and international mobility. The university offers programs in humanities, communication, law, business, architecture, medicine, dentistry, and education, fostering innovation and ethical solutions to global challenges.

tagline: Top Ranked, Research-Intensive University in UAE
description: Khalifa University, established in 2017 through the merger of several institutions, is a public research-intensive university in Abu Dhabi, UAE. It excels in science, engineering, technology, and medicine, offering programs across three colleges and 36 departments. With 14 specialized research centers and strong industry ties, it fosters innovation and prepares students for global challenges in a diverse environment representing over 70 nationalities.

description: The University of Bolton, founded in 1824 as the Bolton Mechanics Institute, is a public university in Bolton, Greater Manchester, UK. tagline: Amazing things happen here
description: The University of Chichester, founded in 1839 as a teacher training college and granted university status in 2005, is a public university in West Sussex, UK. Renowned for its teaching excellence (6th in the UK for teaching quality in NSS 2025) and student satisfaction, it offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate courses in arts, humanities, business, education, health, law, sciences, and sport across two campuses in Chichester and Bognor Regis. With a TEF Gold rating and strong emphasis on employability and community, Chichester fosters a supportive environment for over 6,000 students from around the world.

campusName: City Campus, Irchel Campus, Oerlikon Campus
tagline: Excellence in Research and Education
description: The University of Zurich (UZH), founded in 1833, is Switzerland's largest university and one of Europe's leading research institutions. As a public comprehensive university, it offers over 200 bachelor's and master's programs across seven faculties, including theology, law, medicine, business, arts, sciences, and veterinary medicine. With a diverse student body from over 120 countries, UZH emphasizes interdisciplinary research, innovation, and global collaboration, ranking among the top 100 universities worldwide.

tagline: Science Bridge from History to the Future
description: Istanbul University, founded in 1453 by Sultan Mehmed II, is Turkey's oldest university and a leading public research institution. Reformed in 1933 under Mustafa Kemal Atatürk, it spans 17 faculties, 14 institutes, and multiple campuses, offering programs in medicine, law, business, sciences, humanities, and more. With a diverse student body including over 7,800 international students from 132 countries, it emphasizes research, global partnerships like Erasmus+, and cultural heritage, ranking among the top universities in Turkey and globally.

tagline: Inspiring Minds, Changing Futures
description: Founded in 1885 as the first non-denominational teacher training college for women, Edge Hill University is a public university in Ormskirk, Lancashire. With a 160-acre campus, it offers over 250 undergraduate and postgraduate programs across three faculties: Arts and Sciences, Education, and Health, Social Care and Medicine. Known for its Ofsted 'Outstanding' teacher training and high graduate employability (96.6% within 15 months), Edge Hill combines cutting-edge facilities with a supportive, inclusive community.

campusName: Tha Phra Chan Campus, Rangsit Campus, Pattaya Campus, Lampang Campus
tagline: To uphold academic excellence, services to society, promotion of arts and culture, social equality and social justice under the philosophies of constitutional monarchy and democracy
description: Thammasat University (TU), established on 27 June 1934 as the University of Moral and Political Sciences, is Thailand's second-oldest university and a leading public research institution. Founded by Pridi Banomyong in the wake of the 1932 Siamese Revolution to promote democratic principles, TU has evolved into a comprehensive university offering over 240 programs across 33 faculties in social sciences, humanities, sciences, technology, and health sciences. With campuses in Bangkok (Tha Phra Chan), Rangsit, Pattaya, and Lampang, TU emphasizes interdisciplinary education, research innovation, and social responsibility. Ranked 601-650 in QS World University Rankings 2025 and 501-600 in THE World University Rankings 2025, TU has graduated over 300,000 alumni, including numerous Thai prime ministers and leaders, fostering global impact through 259 international partnerships in 43 countries.

generalInfo: Thammasat University welcomes international students through the Thammasat International Student Recruitment (TISR) program, requiring online applications with transcripts, English proficiency, and financial proof. With a focus on experiential learning, internships, and exchanges with 259 global partners, TU achieves a 96% graduate employment rate within 12 months, ranked #1 in Thailand by QS 2020. Diverse campuses offer modern facilities, cultural immersion, and career support via the Career Development Center, ensuring a vibrant, socially engaged education in Thailand's dynamic environment.

It offers innovative bachelor's and master's programs across seven colleges, focusing on interdisciplinary education, research excellence, and preparing Emirati and international students for leadership roles in a rapidly evolving global landscape.

universityName: National Technical University of Ukraine “Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute”
tagline: A real city of science, education and innovation
description: The National Technical University of Ukraine “Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute” (KPI), founded in 1898, is one of Ukraine's leading public research universities and the largest technical institution in the country. With 14 faculties and over 100 departments, it offers a wide range of programs in engineering, IT, applied mathematics, biotechnology, and more. Known for its strong emphasis on innovation, practical training, and international partnerships, KPI fosters cutting-edge research and prepares students for global careers through internships, exchanges, and industry collaborations.

tagline: The Pursuit of Truth in the Company of Friends
description: Keele University, founded in 1949, is a public research university in Keele, Staffordshire, UK. Renowned for its pioneering dual honours degrees and interdisciplinary approach, Keele occupies a 600-acre rural campus, the largest in the UK, and excels in teaching and research, earning a TEF Gold rating in 2023. With a global community from over 120 countries, it offers a vibrant student experience and strong employability focus.

tagline: A Place to Belong

tagline: To excel in health, sciences, arts, and innovation with integrity for the betterment of Thai society.
description: Mahidol University (MU), an autonomous public research university in Thailand, originated from the establishment of Siriraj Hospital in 1888. Renowned as Thailand's top university, it excels in health sciences, medicine, engineering, natural sciences, business, and humanities. With multiple campuses and a commitment to innovation, MU fosters a diverse international community, advanced research facilities, and global partnerships, preparing students for impactful careers in science, healthcare, and beyond.

tagline: Home of the Two-Year Degree
description: The University of Buckingham, founded in 1976 as the UK's first private university, is an independent, not-for-profit institution in Buckingham, England. Renowned for its innovative two-year undergraduate degrees and small class sizes with a 10.5:1 student-faculty ratio, it offers programs in business, law, medicine, humanities, computing, psychology, and allied health. Serving over 2,700 students from more than 100 countries, Buckingham emphasizes personalized teaching, employability, and a supportive, multicultural environment.

tagline: Advancing Knowledge and Innovation
description: Founded in 1460, the University of Basel is Switzerland's oldest university and a leading international center for research and education. Renowned for its strengths in life sciences and medicine, it comprises seven faculties offering comprehensive bachelor's, master's, and doctoral programs. Situated in the vibrant tri-national region of Basel, the university promotes interdisciplinary collaboration, innovation, and global partnerships, preparing students for impactful careers.

tagline: A Global Hub for Excellence and Innovation
description: Boğaziçi University, founded in 1863 as Robert College and transformed into a Turkish public university in 1971, is a leading research institution in Istanbul. Renowned for its English-medium instruction, interdisciplinary approach, and stunning Bosphorus location, it offers 34 undergraduate, 72 graduate, and 35 PhD programs across engineering, sciences, humanities, social sciences, economics, and education. With 162 research labs and international partnerships, it nurtures innovation and global citizenship among its diverse student body.

The picturesque campuses along the Bosphorus offer a vibrant, multicultural atmosphere with 44 student clubs and access to world-class libraries and labs.

tagline: Discover Your Dreams
description: Sabancı University, founded in 1994 by the Sabancı Foundation, is a private research university in Istanbul adopting a liberal arts education approach. As Turkey's first "departmentless" university, it emphasizes interdisciplinary learning across its four schools: Engineering and Natural Sciences, Arts and Social Sciences, Sabancı Business School, and the School of Languages. With 12% international students, it fosters global perspectives and innovation.

tagline: Thrive Through Change
description: The Royal Agricultural University (RAU), founded in 1845 as the first agricultural college in the English-speaking world, is a public specialist university in Cirencester, UK. Granted full university status in 2013, RAU excels in land-based education, offering innovative undergraduate and postgraduate programs in agriculture, equine science, rural business, environment, and real estate, with a strong emphasis on sustainability, entrepreneurship, and industry connections for global impact.

tagline: Your Future is Our Focus
description: Founded in 1966, Leeds Trinity University is a public institution in Horsforth, Leeds, with a new Leeds City Campus opened in 2024. Known for its employability-focused education, it embeds professional work placements in every undergraduate degree, boasting a 97% graduate employment or further study rate within 15 months. With a close-knit community and small class sizes, it offers personalized support in a vibrant student city.

tagline: Creativity Thrives Here
description: Founded in 1902 as Falmouth School of Art, Falmouth University is a public institution specializing in creative arts, design, media, and performance. Located in Cornwall, it offers over 40 undergraduate and postgraduate programs with a focus on industry-aligned education, professional facilities, and real-world experience. With a 94% graduate employment rate within six months, Falmouth fosters innovation and entrepreneurship in a vibrant coastal setting.

tagline: Flexible Learning for Ambitious Minds
description: Arden University, established in 1990 as Resource Development International (RDI) and granted university status in 2015, is a private for-profit teaching university based in Coventry, UK. Specializing in blended and online distance learning, it offers career-focused undergraduate and postgraduate programs in business, computing, law, psychology, healthcare, and more, serving over 28,000 students globally with a focus on accessibility and employability.

With a strong emphasis on digital skills and employability, it provides 24/7 online access to resources, career services, and industry-accredited programs. Study centers in major UK cities offer blended learning, while online options allow study from anywhere, all at competitive fees.

tagline: Excellence in Education, Research, and Innovation
description: École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL), founded in 1853, is a leading public research university in Lausanne, Switzerland. Specializing in natural sciences and engineering, EPFL hosts over 15,000 students from more than 130 countries across five schools and two colleges. With more than 500 laboratories, it emphasizes interdisciplinary research, innovation, and hands-on learning to address global challenges.

tagline: Science Bridging Nations
description: Founded in 1956 to foster modern science in the Middle East, METU is Turkey’s premier English-medium university, consistently ranked #1 nationally in engineering and natural sciences. Spread across a 4500-hectare forested campus, it hosts 31,000 students from 105 countries and runs 300+ labs, 5 graduate schools, and Turkey’s largest technopark (METUTECH). With 1,500 Erasmus+ partners and NASA-level research funding, METU graduates power ASELSAN, TUSAŞ, and global tech giants.

tagline: Transforming Lives Through Education
description: Buckinghamshire New University (BNU), founded in 1891 as the School of Science and Art, is a public university with campuses in High Wycombe, Aylesbury, Uxbridge, and Great Missenden, UK. Renowned for its career-focused, practical courses in business, healthcare, creative arts, aviation, and more, BNU emphasizes employability with strong industry partnerships and a 96% graduate employment rate.

tagline: Where Creative Futures Begin
description: Founded in 1846, Leeds Arts University is the only specialist arts university in Northern England, located in Leeds, West Yorkshire. With a close-knit community of approximately 2,145 students, it offers a range of creative courses in art, design, media, and performance. Renowned for its industry connections and small class sizes, the university fosters hands-on learning and produces graduates like Henry Moore and Damien Hirst.

description: Founded in 1559, the University of Geneva (UNIGE) is a public research university ranked among the top 100 worldwide. It offers over 500 programs across nine faculties, including sciences, medicine, humanities, and law, with excellence in life sciences, particle physics, and astrophysics. With strong ties to international organizations like WHO and CERN, UNIGE hosts a diverse community and promotes multidisciplinary research and teaching.

universityName: Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv
tagline: Classic University with a Distinct Research Profile
description: Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv (KNU), founded in 1834, is Ukraine's oldest and most prestigious public research university. As a leading academic institution, it offers comprehensive programs across 13 faculties and 8 institutes in fields such as humanities, natural sciences, law, economics, and international relations. With a strong emphasis on research excellence and international collaboration, KNU hosts around 26,000 students, including over 2,000 internationals. The university provides education in Ukrainian, Russian, and English, supported by a vibrant campus life in the heart of Kyiv.

description: United Arab Emirates University (UAEU), founded in 1976 by Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan, is the first and foremost comprehensive national university in the UAE. Located in Al Ain, it offers over 70 undergraduate and 80 graduate programs across nine colleges, emphasizing research excellence, innovation, and cultural heritage. With state-of-the-art facilities and partnerships with over 300 global institutions, UAEU produces highly employable graduates contributing to the UAE Vision 2031.

tagline: This is our place, built around you
description: Staffordshire University, established in 1992 from the merger of North Staffordshire Polytechnic and Staffordshire Polytechnic, is a public research university in Stoke-on-Trent, Staffordshire, UK. With additional campuses in Stafford and London, it offers career-focused courses in business, computing, health, creative arts, and engineering. Ranked highly for social inclusion and facilities, the university emphasizes practical learning, employability, and research excellence, with 100% of research impact rated 'Outstanding' or 'Very Considerable' in the REF 2021.

tagline: A Leading University in the Gulf
description: The American University of Sharjah (AUS), founded in 1997, is a private, non-profit institution offering American-style liberal arts education in the UAE. Ranked among the top universities in the Arab region, AUS provides undergraduate, master's, and PhD programs across architecture, arts, engineering, and business. With a diverse student body from over 94 nationalities and an 88% employability rate, AUS emphasizes research, innovation, and global partnerships.

tagline: Transforming Lives, Enriching Futures
description: Canterbury Christ Church University (CCCU), founded in 1962 as a Church of England teacher training college, is a public research university in Canterbury, Kent, UK. Granted university status in 2005, CCCU offers diverse programs in education, health, arts, sciences, business, and more, with a strong emphasis on employability, sustainability, and community engagement. Affiliated with the Church of England and part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site, it serves over 15,000 students from more than 100 countries.

tagline: Award-winning creativity
description: Arts University Plymouth, founded in 1856 as the Plymouth Drawing School, is an independent specialist arts university in Plymouth, UK. It specializes in creative education across art, design, crafts, and media, with a focus on interdisciplinary practice, social justice, and innovation. Ranked 5th in the UK for Student Satisfaction in the Complete University Guide 2026 and top specialist arts university in the National Student Survey for four consecutive years (2022–2025), AUP fosters a vibrant community of makers and thinkers with award-winning facilities and strong industry links.

tagline: World-Class in a World Heritage City

universityName: Tashkent State Technical University named after Islam Karimov
tagline: Excellence in Technical Education and Innovation
description: Tashkent State Technical University named after Islam Karimov (TSTU), established in 1918, is one of Uzbekistan's oldest and leading public technical universities located in Tashkent. With 8 faculties and 58 departments, it offers bachelor's, master's, and doctoral programs in engineering, energy, electronics, automation, geology, mining, mechanical engineering, oil and gas, and more. Renowned for its focus on practical skills, research, and international collaborations, TSTU prepares over 11,000 students for careers in technical fields, emphasizing innovation and sustainable development.

tagline: Innovation and Opportunity
description: The University of Wolverhampton is a public university with campuses in Wolverhampton, Walsall, Telford, and Shropshire, UK. Gaining university status in 1992 from its polytechnic roots dating back to 1827, it is celebrated for its practical, industry-aligned programs in health, education, business, engineering, arts, design, and social sciences. With strong emphasis on innovation, employability, and inclusivity, the university supports a diverse community and maintains robust partnerships with businesses and communities.

tagline: Be the Change
description: The University of Plymouth, with roots dating back to 1862, is a public research university located on the stunning South West coast of England. Renowned for marine sciences, sustainability, health, engineering, and creative industries, Plymouth is a global leader in ocean research and home to the Plymouth Marine Laboratory. With over 18,000 students from 100+ countries, it combines academic excellence with real-world impact through industry partnerships and immersive learning.

universityName: National University of Uzbekistan named after Mirzo Ulugbek
tagline: Leading Higher Education Institution in Central Asia
description: The National University of Uzbekistan named after Mirzo Ulugbek (NUUz), founded in 1918 as Turkestan People's University, is Uzbekistan's oldest and largest public research university located in Tashkent. Renamed multiple times through history, it gained national status in 2000 and honors the astronomer Mirzo Ulugbek. With 16 faculties and 74 departments, NUUz offers 93 bachelor's, 81 master's, and 98 doctoral programs across sciences, humanities, and social sciences. It leads in research with institutes in applied physics and biophysics, and global partnerships including joint faculties with Kazan Federal University and Holon Institute of Technology. Ranked 781-790 in QS World University Rankings 2025 and 1001–1200 in THE World University Rankings 2025, NUUz fosters innovation and has produced leaders in politics, science, and culture.

generalInfo: National University of Uzbekistan welcomes international students via its online portal, requiring transcripts, language proficiency, and financial proof. With programs in Uzbek, Russian, and select English courses, NUUz emphasizes research, internships, and exchanges with over 200 partners. It achieves high employability through career services and industry ties. The Tashkent campus offers modern labs, libraries with millions of volumes, sports facilities, and cultural centers, while the Yoshlik campus provides affordable dorms and a vibrant student community in a supportive, multicultural environment.

tagline: BE SUFFOLK
description: The University of Suffolk, established in 2007 as University Campus Suffolk, is a public university in Ipswich, UK, with additional sites in Lowestoft and Great Yarmouth. Renowned for its transformative education and student-centered approach, it offers career-focused programs in business, health, arts, digital technology, sustainability, and social justice, holding the Whatuni University of the Year 2025 award and emphasizing employability, research impact, and inclusive learning with strong regional and industry partnerships.

tagline: Soar Higher with a Liberal Arts Education
description: Elmira College, founded in 1855, is a private liberal arts college in Elmira, New York. Known for its Center for Mark Twain Studies and a commitment to community service, Elmira provides a personalized education with small class sizes.

tagline: Transforming lives and communities
description: The University of Lincoln, granted university status in 2002 with roots dating back to 1861, is a public research university in Lincoln, UK. Known for its modern campus overlooking the Brayford Pool and rising global rankings (top 30 in the UK for teaching quality in Times Good University Guide 2026), it offers a broad spectrum of courses in arts, business, engineering, health, law, sciences, and social sciences. With a TEF Gold rating and emphasis on research-informed teaching, employability (95% of graduates in work or further study within six months), and sustainability, Lincoln supports a diverse community of over 18,000 students from 130+ countries.

tagline: Where Creativity Meets Technology

With a strong emphasis on experiential learning, including one of the world’s largest co-op programs, RIT prepares students for careers in diverse fields through hands-on experiences and cutting-edge facilities.

With a focus on experiential learning, technology, and global engagement, Marist provides students with opportunities like the Marist Poll, IBM partnerships, and a unique branch campus in Florence, Italy, fostering a vibrant community dedicated to academic excellence and service.

universityName: Vietnam National University, Ho Chi Minh City (VNU-HCM)
campusName: University of Science Campus, University of Technology Campus, International University Campus
tagline: Excellence in Education, Research, and Innovation
description: Vietnam National University Ho Chi Minh City (VNU-HCM), established in 1995, is a leading public multidisciplinary research university in southern Vietnam. Comprising seven member universities and faculties, it excels in science, technology, engineering, economics, law, social sciences, and pedagogy. With over 60,000 students and a strong emphasis on innovation and international collaboration, VNU-HCM drives national development and global partnerships through cutting-edge research and quality education.

tagline: Do Different
description: The University of East Anglia (UEA), founded in 1963, is a pioneering plate-glass university located on a 320-acre parkland campus in Norwich. Renowned for world-leading research (REF 2021: 91% world-leading or internationally excellent), UEA excels in environmental sciences, creative writing, health, business, and social sciences. Home to the Sainsbury Centre for Visual Arts and the National Centre for Writing, it serves over 18,000 students from more than 100 countries.

With partnerships with 200+ global universities and a 1,000-hectare eco-campus, VNU drives Vietnam’s innovation in AI, biotech, and sustainable development.
